original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po nyid thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po nyid thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: Skill in means is emptiness and great compassion,

original: de dag gis sems can rnams la ma chags shing sdug bsngal las 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sems can rnams la ma chags shing sdug bsngal las 'dren pa'i phyir ro //

original: smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase because they do not abandon sentient beings and because they focus on the vast wisdom of the buddhas explains that.

original: 'di ltar 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces bya ba gsungs pa des sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces bya ba gsungs pa des sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba nyid bstan pa yin te /

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgya che ba la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgya che ba la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The phrase focus on the vast wisdom of the buddhas indicates the thought of awakening.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the infinite qualities of a buddha.

original: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu brjod @95a * //üîΩpa yin te ;
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu brjod @95a * // pa yin te ;
translated: refers to the result.

original: yongs su sbyangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams yongs su dag pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba yin la /
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams yongs su dag pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba yin la /
translated: Having trained, the bodhisattva stages are purified, since the addictions which are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation are abandoned.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis zin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis zin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The perfections are purified, since they are transmundane, being embraced by the three nonapprehensions.

original: spyod pa rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par sprul pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par sprul pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conduct is vast, since it benefits beings by means of the emanation body and the beatific body for as long as the world exists.

original: ji ltar rigs pas zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye ba rnams kyi mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i thabs yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye ba rnams kyi mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i thabs yin la /
translated: As is appropriate refers to the means of attaining the higher states of the various ordinary beings.

original: de las gzhan rnams kyi nges par legs pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams kyi nges par legs pa'i yang ngo //
translated: And the means of attaining definite goodness for those other than them.

original: sa 'di'i tshul khrims la rma med pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa 'di'i tshul khrims la rma med pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the morality of this stage is unblemished,üîΩhe says,

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Just as the ocean, etc.

analyzed: tshul khrims dbang zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmorality is the lord‚Äù means ‚Äúmorality is the basis.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid che zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyun ma chad par tshul khrims la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid che zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyun ma chad par tshul khrims la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù means that one always and continuously abides in morality.

original: de zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to morality.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is selfevident.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the conclusion of morality, he says,

original: tshul khrims kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad du bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad du bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As was taught, etc.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ces pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ces pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall the perfections of virtue‚Äù refers to concentration, etc.

original: gling bzhi'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gling bzhi la dbang pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhing rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dang / sems can rnams kyi 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma spong ba'i nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gling bzhi'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gling bzhi la dbang pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhing rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dang / sems can rnams kyi 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma spong ba'i nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The cause of the abundance of the four continents is as follows: The bodhisattva who abides in this way becomes a universal monarch who rules over the four continents, possessing the seven jewels, and has the ability to eliminate the stains of immorality of sentient beings.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa'i le'u gnyis pa'i t'i k'a'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa'i le'u gnyis pa'i t'i k'a'o /

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the third generation of the enlightenment mind,

analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúNow, the bodhisattva who abides in the perfection of effort‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: shes bya'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: ‚ÄúObject of knowledge‚Äù refers to form, mind, mental factors, and that which is not associated with either of those two, as well as the unconditioned.

original: de rnams nyid bud shing ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid bud shing ste /

original: ji ltar mes bud shing bsregs nas mi snang bar byed pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mes gzugs la sogs pa rnams mi snang bar byed pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar mes bud shing bsregs nas mi snang bar byed pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mes gzugs la sogs pa rnams mi snang bar byed pas so //
translated: Just as fire consumes fuel and makes it invisible, so the fire of the intuition of emptiness makes form, etc. invisible.

original: 'od 'byung phyir zhes bya ba ni sa dang po dang gnyis pa la ltos @95b nas ye shes kyi me cung zad gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od 'byung phyir zhes bya ba ni sa dang po dang gnyis pa la ltos @95b nas ye shes kyi me cung zad gsal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi'o //

original: de ltar yang /üîΩdge dang mi dge rnam rtog gi / rgyu mtshan gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can //üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis stong nyid brjod //
analyzed: de ltar yang / dge dang mi dge rnam rtog gi / rgyu mtshan gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can // sangs rgyas rnams kyis stong nyid brjod //
translated: As has been said:üîΩThe nature of the Buddha is said to be emptiness,

original: ces gsungs pas so ;
analyzed: ces gsungs pas so ;
translated: because it severs the signs of the causes of the conceptualizations of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: / der zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: / der zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa'o //
translated: There, means on the third spiritual level.

original: gnas min 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis khro ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas min 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis khro ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is not a basis for agitation, means that it should be said that this is not a basis for the anger of other bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the existence of such intuition means because of the knowledge of the complete purity of the three sectors.

original: dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa'i dogs pa gang gis gzhan gyi mnar sems kyi gzhir 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa'i dogs pa ni nga la 'dis gnod par byas so //üîΩnga'i grogs po la yang ngo //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa'i dogs pa gang gis gzhan gyi mnar sems kyi gzhir 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la dus gsum gyi don ma yin pa'i dogs pa ni nga la 'dis gnod par byas so // nga'i grogs po la yang ngo //
translated: The phrase the basis for the resentment of others because of the fear of the meaninglessness of the three times means that the fear of the meaninglessness of the three times is the basis for the resentment of others.üîΩOne thinks, He has harmed me, He has harmed my friend, and He has helped my enemy.

original: nga'i dgra bo'i don byas so snyam pa'i 'das pa'i dus la don ma yin pa'i dogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nga'i dgra bo'i don byas so snyam pa'i 'das pa'i dus la don ma yin pa'i dogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, the fear of the meaninglessness of the past arises.

original: de bzhin du da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the present and the future.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase in that way and so on is self-evident.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams khro ba'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams khro ba'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the bodhisattvas are not the basis for anger.

original: sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gnas ma yin par khro ba las byung ba sdig pa'i las dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las de'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gnas ma yin par khro ba las byung ba sdig pa'i las dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe condition of that sinful karma‚Äù means that the sinful karma that arises from anger in an inappropriate situation is the cause of the suffering of the hells, etc.

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the cause of conventional patience.

original: don dam pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the cause of ultimate patience, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gcod pa'i skyes bus so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gcod pa'i skyes bus so //

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus nam gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus nam gyi tshe'o //

original: ji ltar gcod ces bya ba ni mtshon cha la sogs pa'i byed pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar gcod ces bya ba ni mtshon cha la sogs pa'i byed pas so //

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù shows the reason for seeing selflessness.

original: sdig pa'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kyang gi sgra'i don ston pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kyang gi sgra'i don ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe condition of that sinful karma‚Äù shows the meaning of the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: de ltar bzod pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam ba gnyis bstan nas so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang yon tan gyi tshogs bsrung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam ba gnyis bstan nas so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang yon tan gyi tshogs bsrung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /

original: bzod pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bzod pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: khro bas gzhan gyi nyes pa brjod pa las ldog par rigs par @96a * //

analyzed: 'chad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras thal lcag dang khu tshur la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //

original: gal te phar gnod pa byas pas de kho na log na khon gyis de la ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la /

translated: If the other turns away from the harm by the harm done to him, what is the use of the grudge against him?

analyzed: phar gnod pa byas pas zhes bya ba ni dgra bo la slar gnod pa byas pas so //

analyzed: de'i kho na ldog na zhes bya ba ni gal te slar gnod pa byas pas kho na ldog par 'gyur na'o //

analyzed: khon gyis de la ci zhig byas zhes bya ba ni gang sngar dgra bos gnod pa byas pa de la kho na gyis ci zhig byas /

analyzed: cung zad kyang ma byas te /

original: byas zin pa de ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas zin pa de ldog par mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni lan byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni lan byed pas so //

original: 'di'i don ni kho na byed pa'i don med pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas kho na spangs pa dang / bzod pa bsgom pa nyid bstan pa yin no //

original: bzod pa de yang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims las byung ba'i dge ba du ma rnams 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yon tan mtha' dag bsrung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: 'dis ni kho na mi bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni kho na mi bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //

original: da ni kho na byed pa la slar kho na byed ce na /
analyzed: da ni kho na byed pa la slar kho na byed ce na /

analyzed: gang zhig rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever harm one experiences through one‚Äôs own wrongdoing‚Äù and so on.

translated: ‚Äú Whatever harm one experiences through one‚Äôs own wrongdoing‚Äù means that when harm is done by an enemy, it is not done by the enemy.

analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba gzhan du mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i 'bras bu de nyams su myong ba'o //

original: lan du gnod pa byas pas zhi ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lan du gnod pa byas pas zhi ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Peace through retaliation‚Äù means

original: zhi ba ni slar gnod pa byas pas khro ba zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni slar gnod pa byas pas khro ba zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: peace through retaliating.

analyzed: de'i gnod pas pham par 'dod ba zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byas pa'i sgo nas rgyal bar 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhes bya ba ni brdeg pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas dgra bos bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: zad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyams su myong bar zad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExhausting‚Äù means the exhaustion of the experience of the result.

analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa dang ni khro bas zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa gzhan dag la gnod par byed cing kho na byed pas so //

original: da ni ci yang med pa'i skye mchod kyi 'du shes la rag las pa nyid du mthong nas ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las log pa yin pas 'du shes med ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni ci yang med pa'i skye mchod kyi 'du shes la rag las pa nyid du mthong nas ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las log pa yin pas 'du shes med ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is the cultivation of the meditative absorption of infinite consciousness.üîΩCompletely transcending the sense field of infinite space,üîΩhe enters and remains in the meditative absorption of infinite space.üîΩAt that time, since the object is not found, consciousness completely transcends infinite space.üîΩIt focuses on the mere absence of anything at all.üîΩThat is the cultivation of the meditative absorption of infinite space.üîΩCompletely transcending the sense field of infinite consciousness,üîΩhe enters and remains in the meditative absorption of infinite consciousness.üîΩAt that time, since the object is not found, consciousness completely transcends infinite consciousness.üîΩIt focuses on the mere absence of anything at all.üîΩThat is the cultivation of the meditative absorption of infinite consciousness.

original: dper na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes thams cad 'gags par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no//
analyzed: dper na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes thams cad 'gags par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no//
translated: For example, it is not that all ideation ceases in the attainment of non-ideation, as it does in the attainment of non-ideation.

original: 'on kyang mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes shin du phra bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes shin du phra bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, ideation of the signless is very subtle.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: 'du shes med min zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med min zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is called neither ideation nor non-ideation.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mdo'i tshig gi don gyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mdo'i tshig gi don gyi bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the words of the Sutra on the Attainments of Concentration and the Formless.

original: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa 'di rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa 'di rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The establishment of these concentrations and formless attainments should be understood in terms of defilement, purification, establishment, and purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so in terms of defilement?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four roots of the indeterminate:

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i sems dag la nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan gyi sgo nas bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i sems dag la nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan gyi sgo nas bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the afflictions and secondary afflictions are active in the defiled minds of those who are in the formless realm, through the door of defiled meditative concentration.

original: de las sred pas ro myang ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon @100a * //üîΩmongs pa can du 'gyur te /üîΩbsrabs pa'i bde ba'i ro myang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las sred pas ro myang ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon @100a * // mongs pa can du 'gyur te / bsrabs pa'i bde ba'i ro myang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become defiled by the affliction of relishing the taste of craving.

original: lta bas lta ba lhag par bsam gtan pa de nyid nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta bas lta ba lhag par bsam gtan pa de nyid nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: They become defiled by the view of relishing the view.

original: 'di la lta ba lhag par yod pas na lta ba lhag pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: 'di la lta ba lhag par yod pas na lta ba lhag pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: They are called those who relish the view because they have a relish for the view.

original: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i phyir bsam gtan pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i phyir bsam gtan pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: They are called meditators because they possess meditative concentration.

original: de nyid kyang bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyang bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called those who relish the view because they are preoccupied with the view that speculates about the beginning, etc., in dependence on meditative concentration.

original: nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal lhag par bsam gtan pa nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal lhag par bsam gtan pa nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Pride is a defilement of the meditative development of the meditative concentration that is superior to pride.

original: khyad par du rtogs pa des sems pas mtho bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩma rig pas the tshom lhag pa dang bsam gtan pa nyid nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par du rtogs pa des sems pas mtho bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ma rig pas the tshom lhag pa dang bsam gtan pa nyid nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Pride is the defilement of the meditative development of the latter, because it is a mental activity that is inflated on account of that special understanding.

original: de kho na nyid so sor rtogs pas thar pa 'dod pa'i khyad par du rtogs pa de la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid so sor rtogs pas thar pa 'dod pa'i khyad par du rtogs pa de la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance is the defilement of the latter, because doubt arises in regard to that special understanding which is desirous of liberation through the discernment of reality, as to whether or not there is liberation.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the primary and secondary defilements of the realms of form and the formless states operate in those whose minds are defiled.

original: rnam par byang ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that the latter are purified?

original: dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gnyis dge ba yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa yin du zin kyang kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes brjod pa yin no /
analyzed: dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gnyis dge ba yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa yin du zin kyang kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes brjod pa yin no /
translated: Since the pure meditative stabilizations and formless states are virtuous, they are mundane, but they are called pure because they are free from the stains of the entanglements.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is their classification?

original: yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshod zin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming gi rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshod zin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming gi rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are classified by their branches, by their meditative attainment, by their measure and by their name.

original: de ltar bsam gtan la bzhi'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan la bzhi'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meditative stabilizations are classified in four ways.

original: gzugs med pa la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa byed pa yin te /
translated: The formless states are classified in three ways.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa dor nas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa dor nas so //
translated: Among them, the classification by branches is omitted.

original: yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the classification by branches?

original: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first meditative stabilization has five branches:

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The second meditative concentration has four parts:

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yang dag par dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa @100b nyid do ;
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yang dag par dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa @100b nyid do ;
translated: inner clarity, joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: / bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: / bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third meditative concentration has five parts:

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth meditative concentration has four parts:

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt there other mental factors, such as discernment?

original: ci'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are investigation, etc. posited as members?

original: lan ni rnam pa de tsam gyi sgo nas gnyen po'i phyogs dang / phan yon dang / de gnyis kyi rten gyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan ni rnam pa de tsam gyi sgo nas gnyen po'i phyogs dang / phan yon dang / de gnyis kyi rten gyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is: because the member of the antidote, the member of benefit, and the member that is the basis of both are complete in just that aspect.

original: 'di'i don ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang / de gnyis kyi yan lag la brten nas yan lag gi rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang / de gnyis kyi yan lag la brten nas yan lag gi rnam gzhag byed pa yin no // 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that the member of the antidote, the member of benefit, and the member that is the basis of both are posited as members in dependence on each other.

original: de dag gis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, investigation and analysis are members of the antidote in the first concentration because they eliminate the conceptual thoughts of desire, malice, and harm.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag yin te /üîΩrtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'am /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag yin te /üîΩrtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'am /
translated: Joy and pleasure are members of benefit because they are the benefits of the first concentration.üîΩThe mind is the member that is the basis of both because it is the basis of both the antidote and benefit.

original: des dben pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dben pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the joy and happiness born of seclusion.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis kyi rten gyi yan lag yin te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis kyi rten gyi yan lag yin te /
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the member that is the basis of those two,

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i dbang gis rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i dbang gis rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of concentration causes the engagement of investigation, etc.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nang gi bdag nyid kyi dang po ni gnyen po'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nang gi bdag nyid kyi dang po ni gnyen po'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The inner confidence of the second meditation is the member that is the antidote,

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dang ba ni sngar rtog pa dang dpyod pas sems 'khrug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro // de la nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dang ba ni sngar rtog pa dang dpyod pas sems 'khrug pa'i phyir /
translated: because it causes the abandonment of investigation and analysis.

original: sems dmigs pa la ches mi 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: sems dmigs pa la ches mi 'jug pa yin la /
translated: In the first meditation, the mind is not very well placed on the object of meditation, because the mind is disturbed by investigation and analysis.

original: da ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa la sems ches mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa la sems ches mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Now, because it is free from investigation and analysis, the mind is very well placed on the object of meditation.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pas 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu dang bas 'khrug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pas 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu dang bas 'khrug pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not disturbed by investigation and analysis, because it is free from the disturbance of investigation and analysis.

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa sngar bzhin no //üîΩbsam gtan gsum pa'i btang @101a * //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa sngar bzhin no // bsam gtan gsum pa'i btang @101a * //
translated: happiness, and one-pointedness of mind, as before.

original: snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnam pa gnyis po gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnam pa gnyis po gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: The limb of application is the equanimity of the third meditative absorption and the mindfulness and introspection that are its two aspects.

original: de rnams kyi dga' ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dga' ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon joy.

original: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Happiness and one-pointedness of mind should be understood as before.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gtang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gtang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The limb of application in the fourth meditative absorption is pure equanimity and pure mindfulness.

original: de dag gis bde ba spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bde ba spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon happiness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of benefit is the feeling that is neither happiness nor suffering.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the limb that is the basis of both of these.

original: gzugs med pa la ni yan lag gi rnam gzhag yod pa ma yin te ro gcig tu gyur pa'i zhi gnas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la ni yan lag gi rnam gzhag yod pa ma yin te ro gcig tu gyur pa'i zhi gnas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the formless meditative attainments, there is no presentation of limbs because they are based on serenity that is uniform.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of meditative attainment?

original: yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin la /
translated: One enters the first meditative concentration through seven types of attention.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar du'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar du'o ;
translated: The same is true up to the attainment of the neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: / de la yid la byed pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la yid la byed pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven types of attention?

original: mtshan nyid so sor rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / rab tu rnam par dben pa dang / dga' ba yang dag par sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / rab tu rnam par dben pa dang / dga' ba yang dag par sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention to the characteristics, attention of conviction, attention of complete withdrawal, attention of delight, attention of investigation, attention of culmination of practice, and attention of the result of the culmination of practice.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa la yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun ci ltar ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa la yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun ci ltar ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are the seven types of attention related to the attainment of the first meditative concentration?

original: de la gang gi 'dod pa'i yul rnams la mi mthun pa nyid du mthong nas rags pa'i mtshan nyid can du so sor rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gang gi 'dod pa'i yul rnams la mi mthun pa nyid du mthong nas rags pa'i mtshan nyid can du so sor rtog pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, one who sees the objects of desire as disadvantageous investigates their characteristics as gross.

original: bsam gtan dang po na de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na de med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not exist in the first meditation.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can du rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can du rtog pa yin la /
translated: It is imagined to have the characteristic of peace.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Its characteristic is the attention of discernment.

original: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa dag dang 'dres par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa dag dang 'dres par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is to be mixed with learning and reflection.

original: de'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa dag las 'das te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa dag las 'das te /
translated: Therefore, it is beyond learning and reflection.

original: gcig tu nges par bsgom pa'i rnam pas rags pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom zhing yang dang yang du rags pa dang zhi ba nyid lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par bsgom pa'i rnam pas rags pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom zhing yang dang yang du rags pa dang zhi ba nyid lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of serenity and insight, which are the aspects of meditation that are beyond doubt, and it is the attention that repeatedly aspires to coarseness and peace.

original: de goms pa las dang por spong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa yid la byed pa ni rab tu rnam par dben pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: de goms pa las dang por spong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa yid la byed pa ni rab tu rnam par dben pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: From the cultivation of that, the attention that is associated with the first path of elimination is the attention of complete isolation.

original: des nyon mongs pa chen po spong ba'i @101b phyir dang / de'i phyogs su gyur pa'i gnas ngan len 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa chen po spong ba'i @101b phyir dang / de'i phyogs su gyur pa'i gnas ngan len 'gags pa'o //
translated: Because it eliminates the great afflictions and it stops the negative reflex actions that are associated with it.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa de rab tu spangs pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spangs pa'i phan yon mthong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa de rab tu spangs pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spangs pa'i phan yon mthong la /
translated: Therefore, the yogi delights in complete rejection and sees the benefits of rejection.

original: dben pa cung zad kyis dga' ba dang bde ba 'dres par 'gyur ba de dus rgyun du yid la byed pa dran pa'i sgo nas bying ba dang / rgod pa spong ba'i don du sems dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dben pa cung zad kyis dga' ba dang bde ba 'dres par 'gyur ba de dus rgyun du yid la byed pa dran pa'i sgo nas bying ba dang / rgod pa spong ba'i don du sems dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: When a little solitude is mixed with delight and pleasure, that is the mental attention that is delight and collection, which is the mental attention that delights the mind in order to abandon laxity and excitement through the door of mindfulness that is continuous at that time.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sbyor ba po de'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa kun du mi spyod par gyur nas spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du de skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sbyor ba po de'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa kun du mi spyod par gyur nas spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du de skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: When the one who is correctly engaged through application to the side of virtue does not engage in the afflictions and entanglements of the desire realm, in order to understand what has been abandoned and what has not been abandoned, the mental attention that is investigation is the mental attention of investigation, which is the mental attention that is the cause of the arising of the path of cultivation.

original: spyod pa'i yid la byed pa de la spyad cing gnyen po bsgoms pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i don du bsam gtan dang / po rnal 'byor mthar thug par gyur pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i yid la byed pa de la spyad cing gnyen po bsgoms pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i don du bsam gtan dang / po rnal 'byor mthar thug par gyur pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The attention of the culmination of practice is the culmination of the yoga of the meditative development of the meditative concentration that is conducive to the attainment of freedom from the defilements of the realm of desire.

original: de'i de ma thag tu bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Immediately after that, the attainment of the actual meditative concentration of the first meditative concentration is the attention of the result of the culmination of practice.

original: de la mtshan nyid so sor rtog pas spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba dag yang dag par shes nas thob pa'i don du sems smon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid so sor rtog pas spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba dag yang dag par shes nas thob pa'i don du sems smon par byed pa'o //
translated: Having correctly understood the characteristics of that which is to be relinquished through analysis and that which is to be attained, one directs one's mind to the attainment of the latter.

original: lhag par mos pa ni de'i don du yang dag pa'i sbyor bas rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa ni de'i don du yang dag pa'i sbyor bas rtsom pa yin no //
translated: One has faith in the latter, and one undertakes the correct application for the sake of the latter.

original: rab tu rnam par dben pas nyon mongs pa chen po rab tu spong ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par dben pas nyon mongs pa chen po rab tu spong ba yin no //
translated: One relinquishes the great defilements through complete seclusion.

original: dga' ba yang dag par sdud pas nyon mongs ba 'bring rab tu spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag par sdud pas nyon mongs ba 'bring rab tu spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The joy that is fully collected causes one to abandon the middling afflictions.

original: sbyor bas thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid la sems rnam par 'god pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bas thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid la sems rnam par 'god pa'o //
translated: The mental placement that is the attainment through application is the absence of pride.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu rab tu spong ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu rab tu spong ba yin no //
translated: The culmination of application causes one to abandon the lesser afflictions.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu ni yang dag par bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa 'di rnams la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus nyams su myong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu ni yang dag par bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa 'di rnams la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus nyams su myong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The result of the culmination of application is the experience of the result of meditation on these mental placements of correct meditation.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid la byed pa bdun yod pa de bzhin du yod min med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid la byed pa bdun yod pa de bzhin du yod min med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as there are seven mental placements in the first meditative concentration, so too there are seven mental placements in each of the remaining meditative concentrations and formless states, as is appropriate.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar thams cad la mdor bsdus nas @102a * //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar thams cad la mdor bsdus nas @102a * //
translated: In brief, all the formless states up to the base of nothingness are the result of the mental placement of correct separation.

original: rags pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rags pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of the gross should be understood as twofold:

original: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pa nyid kyis shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa nyid dang ches tshe thung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pa nyid kyis shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa nyid dang ches tshe thung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because of the extreme suffering of the abode of the non-pacified, and because of the extreme brevity of life.

original: de la sa gong ma rnams su de las bzlog pa zhi ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sa gong ma rnams su de las bzlog pa zhi ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: In the higher stages, the opposite of that should be understood as the pacified.

original: tshod zin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩbsam gtan dang po chung ngur bsgom pa dang / 'bring du bsgom pa dang / chen por bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa lhag ma rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: tshod zin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na / bsam gtan dang po chung ngur bsgom pa dang / 'bring du bsgom pa dang / chen por bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa lhag ma rnams la yang ngo //
translated: What is the definition of the limited?üîΩThe cultivation of the first meditation is limited, middling, and great; and in the same way, the remaining meditations and attainments.

original: bsam gtan dang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan du skye ba gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan du skye ba gsum mo //
translated: The result of the cultivation of the first meditation as limited, middling, and great is the three births in the Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, and Brahmaparsadya realms.

original: bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan lhag ma rnams la yang bsam gtan du skye ba gsum gsum ste /üîΩ'di ltar tshangs ris la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan lhag ma rnams la yang bsam gtan du skye ba gsum gsum ste / 'di ltar tshangs ris la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as in the first absorption, so too in the remaining absorptions there are three types of birth in the absorptions.üîΩThus, the three types of birth in the second absorption are BrahmakƒÅyika, Brahmapurohita, and MahƒÅbrahma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan gsum pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan gsum pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The third absorption is stated in the same way.

original: 'o na bsam gtan bzhi pa sa brgyad par ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bsam gtan bzhi pa sa brgyad par ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: But how can the fourth absorption be said to have eight levels?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not,

original: der gnas gtsang mas lnga yin pas so //
analyzed: der gnas gtsang mas lnga yin pas so //
translated: because the pure abodes are the fifth.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no classification of birth in the formless realm because there is no other place there.

original: des na gzugs med pa rnams chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms pas mtho ba dang / dma' ba nyid dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa nyid yod par yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzugs med pa rnams chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms pas mtho ba dang / dma' ba nyid dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa nyid yod par yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the formless realm is higher or lower, inferior or excellent, due to cultivating small, medium, and great virtue.

original: de la skyes pa la mtho ba dang / dma' ba nyid ni tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: de la skyes pa la mtho ba dang / dma' ba nyid ni tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: Higher and lower in terms of birth refers to differences in lifespan and so on.

original: dman pa dang / gya nom pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: dman pa dang / gya nom pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: Inferior and excellent are distinguished according to whether they are predominantly defiled or undefiled.

original: ming gi rnam gzhag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi rnam gzhag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of their names?

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed yod pa la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gis ming yang mi shes na shes pa dang snyoms par 'jug par lta gal
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed yod pa la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gis ming yang mi shes na shes pa dang snyoms par 'jug par lta gal
translated: The samadhis included in the first meditation, which the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas enter into, are not even known by their names by the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, much less can they know them and enter into them.

original: 'gyur te / 'di rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi dbye ba rnams kyi ming bgrang du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'gyur te / 'di rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi dbye ba rnams kyi ming bgrang du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the classifications of their meditations are innumerable, countless, and inconceivable.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya phrag @102b gcig gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya phrag @102b gcig gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the Perfection of Wisdom it is said that there are one hundred samadhis.

original: de bzhin du thag pa chen po'i mdo gzhan de dang der spong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du thag pa chen po'i mdo gzhan de dang der spong ngo //
translated: And so, in other Mahayana sutras, they are abandoned.

original: ci ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa de bzhin du bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa de bzhin du bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is included in the first meditative concentration, so it should be understood as included in the remaining meditative concentrations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its purity?

original: rab kyi mthar thug pa'i bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug pa'i bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The culmination of the summit is called purity, from the first meditative concentration up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: yon tan khyad par can bsgrub pa'i don du las su rung ba nyid mthar thug par byed pas so //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can bsgrub pa'i don du las su rung ba nyid mthar thug par byed pas so //
translated: Because it brings about the culmination of the suitability for the accomplishment of special qualities.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of the inclusion of the meditative concentrations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste zhes pa la tshad med pa ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa dang / tshad med pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu yin pa dang / tshad med pa'i chos thob pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas na tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste zhes pa la tshad med pa ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa dang / tshad med pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu yin pa dang / tshad med pa'i chos thob pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas na tshad med pa'o //
translated: The immeasurables are so called because they focus on an immeasurable number of sentient beings, because they are the cause for the accumulation of immeasurable merit, because they are the cause for attaining immeasurable qualities and because they are the domain of immeasurable transcendent wisdom.

original: de yang bzhi ste byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bzhi ste byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are four: immeasurable love, immeasurable compassion, immeasurable joy and immeasurable equanimity.

original: de la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Love is threefold:

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sar sems can la dmigs pa dang / sa dang po nas brtsams te sa bdun pa'i bar chos la dmigs pa dang / sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sar sems can la dmigs pa dang / sa dang po nas brtsams te sa bdun pa'i bar chos la dmigs pa dang / sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: on the level of earnest aspiration, it focuses on sentient beings, on the first to the seventh spiritual levels, it focuses on the phenomenal and from the eighth level onward, it is without focus.

original: snying rje yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snying rje yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Compassion is also threefold:

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen ma tshang bas ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen ma tshang bas ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of compassion is sentient beings who are suffering, the object of sympathetic joy is sentient beings who are happy, and the object of equanimity is sentient beings who are neither happy nor suffering.

original: dga' ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dga' ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Sympathetic joy is also threefold:

original: sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la dmigs pa dang / bdag gi tshogs rdzogs pa la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi rol dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la dmigs pa dang / bdag gi tshogs rdzogs pa la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi rol dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of sympathetic joy is sentient beings who are happy, the object of sympathetic joy is the completion of one's own collection, and the object of sympathetic joy is the taste of the holy Dharma.

original: btang snyoms kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Equanimity is also threefold:

original: sems can gyi don yod pa la snod dang / snod ma yin pa la dmigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don yod pa la snod dang / snod ma yin pa la dmigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of equanimity is the existence of the welfare of sentient beings, the object of equanimity is the equality of worldly dharmas such as gain and loss, and the object of equanimity is the timely and untimely completion of the collection.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase a mind endowed with love indicates the quality itself.

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yon tan bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yon tan bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúvast‚Äù and so on indicate its excellences.

original: de la yon tan ni gsum ste /üîΩchen po nyid dang / bdag gcig pa nyid dang / 'tshe ba @103a * //
analyzed: de la yon tan ni gsum ste / chen po nyid dang / bdag gcig pa nyid dang / 'tshe ba @103a * //
translated: There are three excellences:

original: dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba'o //
translated: greatness, unity, and freedom from harm.

original: de la chen po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la chen po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Greatness is threefold:

original: bsam pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dmigs pas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dmigs pas so //
translated: of thought, of increase, and of objective.

original: de la bsam pa che ba nyid ni yangs pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'phel ba che ba nyid ni rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: de la bsam pa che ba nyid ni yangs pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no // 'phel ba che ba nyid ni rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no ;
translated: The greatness of thought is indicated by the word ‚Äúvast.‚ÄùüîΩThe greatness of increase is indicated by the word ‚Äúboundless.‚Äù

original: / dmigs pa che ba nyid ni tshad med pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: / dmigs pa che ba nyid ni tshad med pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The greatness of objective is indicated by the word ‚Äúimmeasurable,‚Äù

original: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gcig tu byams pa'i rnam pa can yin pas bdag nyid gcig pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gcig tu byams pa'i rnam pa can yin pas bdag nyid gcig pa ston pa ni /
translated: because it has as its object immeasurable sentient beings.üîΩThe unity of the thought of love is indicated by the words ‚Äúnondual‚Äù and ‚Äúof one taste.‚Äù

original: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The unity of its aspect is indicated by the word ‚Äúnondual.‚Äù

original: gnod sems kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nang gi bdag nyid chos kyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med par ston pa ni kho na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nang gi bdag nyid chos kyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med par ston pa ni kho na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of injury is the absence of injury that is done by oneself, by one's own mind, by one's own volition, and it is taught as the antidote to malice.

original: phyi'i sems can gyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med par ston pa ni 'gran zla med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i sems can gyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med par ston pa ni 'gran zla med pa'o //
translated: The absence of injury is the absence of injury that is done by other sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the absence of obscuration.

original: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med pas so //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gyis byas pa'i 'tshe ba med pas so //
translated: The absence of injury is the absence of injury that is done by external objects.

original: thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni grogs dang / tha mal pa dang / dgra bo la yang 'jug pa yin pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni grogs dang / tha mal pa dang / dgra bo la yang 'jug pa yin pas so //
translated: It is all-pervading because it is present in friends, strangers, and enemies.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is the expanse of the Dharma because its nature is emptiness.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu rnams su khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu rnams su khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It extends as far as the realm of space because it pervades the ten directions.

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes smras so //

original: gzhan du nyon mongs pa thams cad gti mug gi cha dang ldan pa yin pas gti mug spangs nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang bar 'gyur bas da ltar nyid du phyir mi spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du nyon mongs pa thams cad gti mug gi cha dang ldan pa yin pas gti mug spangs nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang bar 'gyur bas da ltar nyid du phyir mi spong bar 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

original: skye ba med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //

original: 'dod pa'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba @105a * //

analyzed: tshig rkang 'og ma gnyis bshad par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: gtso bo yin zhing zhes bya ba ni dbang po yin pas so //

translated: ‚ÄúPraised‚Äù means taught.

analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams la bsod nams kyi tshogs mi srid pa ni ma yin no //

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩbrgya ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / brgya ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /

analyzed: de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs du ma bsags pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas na bsod nams brgya'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Since it is characterized by the accumulation of the many collections of merit, it is characterized by the hundred merits.

original: rmad du byung zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa //

analyzed: de la mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir rmad du byung ba'o //

analyzed: chos kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni skye ba med pas chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'gro ba'i mun pa rnam par 'joms par 'dod //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mun pa rnam par 'joms par 'dod //
translated: He wishes to destroy the darkness of the world.

original: ces pa ni sa gsum pa thob pa la ni gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sa gsum pa thob pa la ni gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed par 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: rang gtogs mun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sa gsum pa'i sgrib pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu nye bar bstan pa las zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa'i sgrib pa spong pa'i thabs bstan pa las so //
translated: From the teaching of the method of abandoning the obscurations of the third ground, as described above.

original: yon tan zhes pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag gcig la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pas so //
analyzed: yon tan zhes pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag gcig la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúGood qualities‚Äù refers to the attainment of the perfection of patience and the good qualities of a hundred thousand concentrations, and so forth.

original: bcom pas zhes pa ni sa gsum pa thob pa la gegs byed pa ni nyes pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom pas zhes pa ni sa gsum pa thob pa la gegs byed pa ni nyes pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúDestroyed‚Äù refers to the faults that obstruct the attainment of the third ground.

original: de nyid mun pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid mun pa ste /

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pas so //

original: bcom pa ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom pa ni spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestroyed‚Äù means abandoned.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the third chapter of the commentary on the ‚ÄúEntry into the Middle Way.‚Äù

original: // / sems bskyed pa bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / sems bskyed pa bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the fourth generation of the mind of enlightenment,

analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu @106a * //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúNow, the fourth ground, the Radiant, is explained.‚Äù

analyzed: phyin pa lhag par bstan pa'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sa bzhi par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu ston par 'gyur bas so //

analyzed: yon tan ma lus zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All good qualities refers to the applications of mindfulness, etc., the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc.

analyzed: 'bar bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhag par gyur pa zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / dge ba'i las la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa 'phel ba dang thob pa srid pas zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams 'phel ba dang / ma thob pa rnams thob pa srid pas so //
translated: The increase of attained and unattained, and the possibility of attainment.üîΩThe two accumulations were previously explained as the cause.

analyzed: 'od 'phro ba'i nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the definition of the radiant,üîΩhe says,

original: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //

analyzed: de nyid la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: brtun pa dang zhes bya ba ni gus pa dang rgyun du sbyor bas so //
analyzed: brtun pa dang zhes bya ba ni gus pa dang rgyun du sbyor bas so //

analyzed: shes bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin dang ldan pa yin pas so //

analyzed: brtson 'grus dang shes rab dang / dran pa'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the benefits of effort, wisdom, and mindfulness,üîΩhe says,

original: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la'o //
translated: The world is the eight worldly dharmas.

original: brnab sems dang zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / bde ba dang / bstod pa la chags pa'o //

translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The complete abandonment of the view of the transitory collection is the abandonment of the four aspects of the great stage of the innate view of the transitory collection, up to the abandonment of the great of the middling stage in the desire realm.

analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni sngar bshad zin to //

analyzed: de la gzhan dag gis rgol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid do //

analyzed: gzhan la ma gsan par zhes bya ba ni rang byung ye shes mnga' bas so //

analyzed: bden pa gsum pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rgol ba'i don nyid dngos su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words, ‚Äúthere would be no third truth at all,‚Äù directly show the meaning of the objection.

analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi dgongs pa dang yang mi 'gal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this does not contradict the purport of the master Nagarjuna, he says:üîΩThe Madhyamika also

analyzed: bden pa gnyis gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //

original: kun nas sgrib par byed pas na kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: kun nas sgrib par byed pas na kun rdzob ste /

analyzed: de yang brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad rnams ni 'jig rten du kun rdzob pa'o //

analyzed: gal te 'jig rten kun rdzob ces brjod pas 'jig rten ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyang yod dam zhes na ma yin te /

analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob ces bya ba smos pa yin no //

original: 'di ni 'grel pa nyid las gsal bar ston par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu bden pa yin pas na 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa ste /

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang ; shes pa dang / shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di rnams la 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang ; shes pa dang / shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di rnams la 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The expressions ‚Äúthat which is to be expressed‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which expresses,‚Äù ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is to be known,‚Äù and so on, are called the worldly conventional truth.

original: don dam pa la de rnams yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa la de rnams yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist in the ultimate.

original: de la ni /
analyzed: de la ni /
translated: In that regard,

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa yin //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa yin //
translated: that which is to be expressed is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul log pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul log pa yin //
translated: The domain of mind is stopped.

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das pa bzhin //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das pa bzhin //
translated: like the nature of reality, nirvana.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Since it is said,

translated: That ultimate is not realized in dependence on another, is peace, is the nature of the self-cognized of the noble ones, and is beyond all conceptual elaborations, is not taught, is not known.

analyzed: de ltar na yang /

analyzed: gzhan la ltos min zhi ba yin //

original: spros pas spros pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: spros pas spros pa ma yin zhing //

analyzed: 'di ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: de la lan ni bshad pa gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu'i cha la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: khyed kyi theg pa'i dbye ba med //

original: theg pa gsum du bstan pa ni //

analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //

analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes pa yin no //

analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni kun rdzob kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no ;

original: / zag pa med pa ni lam dang de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: / zag pa med pa ni lam dang de kho na nyid do //

original: de la lam ni kun rdzob kyi bden par ro //
analyzed: de la lam ni kun rdzob kyi bden par ro //

original: de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i bden par ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i bden par ro //

original: de bzhin du 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la'ang shes par bya'o //

original: phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩphung po rnams ni du /üîΩkhams rnams ni du /
analyzed: phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / phung po rnams ni du / khams rnams ni du /

original: skye mched rnams ni du /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni du /
translated: How many are sense bases?

original: ci'i phyir na phung po /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na phung po /
translated: Why are they aggregates?

original: ci'i phyir na khams /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na khams /
translated: Why are they called elements?üîΩWhy are they called sense bases?

analyzed: ci'i phyir na skye mched rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su rtogs pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden par rab tu shes pa'o //

analyzed: de la phye ste rtogs pa ni 'di dang 'di lta bu'o zhes rab tu shes pa'o //

original: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //

original: lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni 'khor ba 'dren par byed pa yin pas lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni 'khor ba 'dren par byed pa yin pas lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the occurrence of harm to body and mind‚Äù means that attachment to things leads to the transmigration of cyclic life, and therefore it causes harm to body and mind.

original: dngos po la bden par mngon par zhen pa yang kun rdzob tu bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la bden par mngon par zhen pa yang kun rdzob tu bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Attachment to things as real belongs to the class of conventional truth.

original: @110a * // 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor bar gtogs pas zhes bya ba ni che ge mo'i 'gro ba che ge mor skyes so snyam pa'i lha'i 'gro ba la sogs par skyes pas yongs su shes pas rab tu skye ba'i bden par rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: @110a * // 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor bar gtogs pas zhes bya ba ni che ge mo'i 'gro ba che ge mor skyes so snyam pa'i lha'i 'gro ba la sogs par skyes pas yongs su shes pas rab tu skye ba'i bden par rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase in terms of the connection with a life-form means that one understands the truth of arising by means of the knowledge that one has been born in a particular life-form, such as the divine life-form, etc., thinking, I have been born in such and such a life-form.

analyzed: 'gro ba nying mtshams sbyor ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pas so //

analyzed: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas zhes bya ba la /

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin par byed pa'i lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar byed pas na yongs su gdung bar byed pa'o //

original: de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang gsum ste /

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //

original: de nyid rims nad de gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la brten nas chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi yongs su gdung bas gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags ni gang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la rjes su chags pa'o //

original: shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa yongs su zad pas so //
analyzed: shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa yongs su zad pas so //

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni sngar bstan zin to //

analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //

original: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa med med pa mngon par 'du byas pas so //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa med med pa mngon par 'du byas pas so //

original: lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i dus su zag pa med pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa ni bden pa yin la /üîΩde la shes pa ni lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa ste /

original: sems can gyi don bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba yin la /

analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'dod pa ste bsgrubs nas so //

translated: The arising of the Tathagata's gnosis is the cause of the Tathagata, because it is the realization of all aspects and the accomplishment of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
