original: // / sems bskyed pa drug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: des na lam la mngon du phyogs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir /

translated: Having attained the stage of Perfect Joy,

original: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon du mdzad pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i sa thob nas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon du mdzad pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i sa thob nas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means having attained the stage of Perfect Joy, which is the direct realization of the thatness of all phenomena.

original: lung gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lung gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach another scripture,üîΩhe says,

original: yang 'phags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, the noble one... and so on.

original: litstsha b'i zhes bya ba ni rus so //
analyzed: litstsha b'i zhes bya ba ni rus so //
translated: Licchavi is a clan name.

original: gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni lo nyung bas so //
analyzed: gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni lo nyung bas so //
translated: Youth means having few years.

original: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i rim pas so //
translated: In due course means by the stages of the stages of Stainless and so on.

original: gal te lung ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lung ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked how scripture is valid cognition,

original: 'di ltar lung nyes pa zad pas byas pa yin pas na tshad mar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung nyes pa zad pas byas pa yin pas na tshad mar 'gyur ram /
translated: is it because scripture is made by one whose faults are exhausted, so it is valid cognition?

original: skyes bus ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa yin /
translated: Or is it not made by a person?

original: de la phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first position is not so,üîΩbecause it is not established that the one who made it has exhausted faults.

original: nyes pa zad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa zad pa dang / yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang ldan pa dang / brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa zad pa dang / yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang ldan pa dang / brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of faults refers to the exhaustion of faults such as passion, the possession of the vision of the perfect meaning just as it is, and the possession of the qualities of compassion and so on.

original: nges byas pa ni nyes pa zad pas byas pa zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: nges byas pa ni nyes pa zad pas byas pa zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The definite is that which is said to be made by the exhaustion of faults.

original: nyes pa zad pas byas pa yin par nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyes pa zad pas byas pa yin par nges par mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot be ascertained that it is made by the exhaustion of faults,

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi sems shes par mi nus pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi sems shes par mi nus pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of another cannot be known.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin la /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the mind of another is by way of effect,

original: ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by way of essence,

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because that itself is to be established.

original: lus kyi bya ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas gzhan du bya bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas gzhan du bya bar nus pa yin te /
translated: The effect of bodily action and so on can also be made otherwise by the desire of the person.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bya ba byed par mthong ba dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzhin du bya ba byed par mthong bas de'i phyir nyes pa zad pa nyid kyi rtags nges par mi nus pas nges par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bya ba byed par mthong ba dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzhin du bya ba byed par mthong bas de'i phyir nyes pa zad pa nyid kyi rtags nges par mi nus pas nges par dka' ba yin no //
translated: and those who are free of attachment act like those who have attachment. Therefore, because it is impossible to ascertain the sign of the exhaustion of faults, it is difficult to ascertain.

original: des na nyes pa zad pas byas par nges pas lung nyes pa zad pas tshad ma nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: des na nyes pa zad pas byas par nges pas lung nyes pa zad pas tshad ma nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: Thus, because it is ascertained that the scriptures are produced by the exhaustion of faults, they are not established as valid knowledge due to the exhaustion of faults.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Also, scriptures not produced by a person are not established as valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung tshad mar smra ba rnams 'di ltar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung tshad mar smra ba rnams 'di ltar brjod pa yin te /
translated: In this way, those who advocate that scriptures not produced by a person are valid knowledge say the following:

original: skyes bu ni yon tan dang skyon gyi rten du gyur pa yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i ngag rnams la phyin ci log gi don yang srid la /
analyzed: skyes bu ni yon tan dang skyon gyi rten du gyur pa yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i ngag rnams la phyin ci log gi don yang srid la /
translated: Since a person is the support of good qualities and faults, it is possible that speech produced by him has a mistaken meaning and

original: bden pa'i don yang srid pas /
analyzed: bden pa'i don yang srid pas /
translated: it is possible that it has a true meaning.

original: des @113b na skyes bu log pas don phyin ci log tu ston pa'i the tshom ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig tshad mar 'dod pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des @113b na skyes bu log pas don phyin ci log tu ston pa'i the tshom ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig tshad mar 'dod pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is the person who, by error, teaches the meaning in a distorted way, the person is not the valid means of knowledge.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir ngag rnams kyi phyin ci log dang / bden pa nyid kyi rten du gyur pa yon tan dang skyon dang ldan pa'i skyes bu log pas ngan med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngag rnams kyi phyin ci log dang / bden pa nyid kyi rten du gyur pa yon tan dang skyon dang ldan pa'i skyes bu log pas ngan med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it follows that speech is not distorted and is the basis of truth, the person who possesses good qualities and faults is not distorted.

original: bden pa nyid dang brdzun pa nyid la tha dad du gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: bden pa nyid dang brdzun pa nyid la tha dad du gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan med pas so //
translated: This is because there is no other aspect that is different from truth and falsity.

original: gzhan yang mgrin pa la sogs pa'i gnas dang byed pas sgra rnams 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ci ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur /üîΩgal te gnas dang byed pa la sogs pas sgra gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang mgrin pa la sogs pa'i gnas dang byed pas sgra rnams 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ci ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur / gal te gnas dang byed pa la sogs pas sgra gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, because it is seen that sounds arise from the place of the throat and so on and from the action of the person, how could they be non-artificially produced?

original: skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the place, the action, and so on clarify sound but do not produce it,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also illogical.

original: gal te gsal bar byed na gsal ba nyid de sgra rnams kyi rang bzhin khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gsal bar byed na gsal ba nyid de sgra rnams kyi rang bzhin khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: If it makes them manifest, then manifestation would be a special quality of sounds.

original: sgra la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: sgra la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Or would it be that sounds are not obstructed?

original: 'on te shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Or would it be that it produces consciousness?

original: de la sgra rnams rang bzhin gyi khyad par du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgra rnams rang bzhin gyi khyad par du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not make sounds a special quality,

original: rtag pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: because it is permanent.

original: sgrib pa dang bral ba yang yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also not that it is free from obstruction,

original: rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgrib pas sgra la cung zad kyang ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgrib pas sgra la cung zad kyang ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent, and because obstruction does not do anything to sound at all.

original: shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not that it produces consciousness,

original: rtag pa'i phyir sgra rnams rgyun du shes pa bskyed par rung ba yin pas so ;
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir sgra rnams rgyun du shes pa bskyed par rung ba yin pas so ;
translated: because it is permanent, and because it is not suitable for sounds to produce consciousness continuously.

original: / des na gsal bar byed pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: / des na gsal bar byed pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that it makes them manifest.

original: des na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du ma grub pas lung tshad ma ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du ma grub pas lung tshad ma ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Since it is not established that it is not produced by a person, how is scripture a valid means of knowledge?

original: de la lan ni ci ltar 'jig rten pa'i tshig tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du lung yang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de la lan ni ci ltar 'jig rten pa'i tshig tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du lung yang tshad ma yin te /
translated: The answer to that is: Just as worldly speech is valid cognition, so too is scripture.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs dang ldan pa dang ; skyes bu'i don rjod par byed pa dang / mi slu ba'i tshig ni tshad mar 'dod pa yin no //üîΩde la 'brel pa ni gang du tshig rnams kyi yan lag dang / yan lag can du gyur pas bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs dang ldan pa dang ; skyes bu'i don rjod par byed pa dang / mi slu ba'i tshig ni tshad mar 'dod pa yin no // de la 'brel pa ni gang du tshig rnams kyi yan lag dang / yan lag can du gyur pas bsgrub pa'am /
translated: Thus, in the world, speech that is connected, that has a method that is suitable, that expresses the purpose of a person, and that is non-deceptive speech is accepted as valid cognition.üîΩHere, connection is that by which, through the parts and wholes of words, a single meaning to be established,

original: dgag pa'am / btang snyoms kyi don gcig rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa'am / btang snyoms kyi don gcig rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: negated, or left as it is is understood.

original: de la grang ma 'brel pa'i tshig de ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de la grang ma 'brel pa'i tshig de ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: Speech that is not connected is not valid cognition.

original: dper na se'u bcu sgyed pu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na se'u bcu sgyed pu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, ‚Äúten mangoes, three stools,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di rnams don gcig la nye bar bsdu ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams don gcig la nye bar bsdu ba med pa yin te /
translated: These do not include a single meaning,

original: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not mutually connected.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i thabs ni gang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i thabs sgrub par nus pa de la rjes su @114a * //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i thabs ni gang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i thabs sgrub par nus pa de la rjes su @114a * //
translated: The method that is in accordance with the result is the method that is capable of accomplishing the result.

original: mthun pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the method that is in accordance with the result.

original: de lta bu'i tshig ni 'jig rten pas tshad ma nyid du khas len gyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig ni 'jig rten pas tshad ma nyid du khas len gyi /
translated: Such words are accepted as valid by worldly people,

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by others.

original: dper na dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jog po'i gtsug gi nor bu len pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jog po'i gtsug gi nor bu len pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a treatise on obtaining the crest jewel of Varu·πáa in order to pacify poison.

original: de ltar gyur pa yin kyang gal te skyes bu'i don brjod pa ma yin par gyur na de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin kyang gal te skyes bu'i don brjod pa ma yin par gyur na de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is like that, if it does not express the purpose of a person, then at that time it is not valid cognition.

original: dper na bya rog gi so rtog pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bya rog gi so rtog pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a treatise on examining the teeth of a crow.

original: de dag de lta bur kyang rtog dpyod byas nas mi slu ba yin na de'i tshe tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag de lta bur kyang rtog dpyod byas nas mi slu ba yin na de'i tshe tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Even though they are investigated in that way, if they are non-deceptive, then at that time they are valid cognition.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not otherwise.

original: dper na mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gis gnod pa'i don lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gis gnod pa'i don lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a meaning that is contradicted by direct perception, inference, or scripture.

original: mi slu ba zhes bya ba ni ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba zhes bya ba ni ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is nondeceptive?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir yul gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir yul gsum ste /
translated: Here there are three objects:

original: mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur pa dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur pa dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: directly perceptible, hidden, and extremely hidden.üîΩWith regard to those, the treatise attainment of knowledge says:

original: de la bstan bcos las mngon sum du 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la mngon sum gyi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis mi gnod pa ni mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos las mngon sum du 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la mngon sum gyi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis mi gnod pa ni mi slu ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is asserted to be directly perceptible is nondeceptive with regard to the object that is the object of direct perception because it is not undermined by direct perception.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like blue and so on.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum la sogs pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du grub pas mngon sum gyis mi gnod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum la sogs pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du grub pas mngon sum gyis mi gnod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, that which is asserted to be not directly perceptible is established as not being direct perception because it is not undermined by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi mngon sum pa nyid du bstan pa nyid sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' las mngon sum ma yin pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi mngon sum pa nyid du bstan pa nyid sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' las mngon sum ma yin pa la /
translated: For example, it is like the other‚Äôs direct perception.

original: de rnams dpyad na mngon sum ma yin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de rnams dpyad na mngon sum ma yin pa kho na yin te /
translated: When those are analyzed, they are only not direct perception.

original: dper na sgra la gnas pa'i rang bzhin bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra la gnas pa'i rang bzhin bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: For example, whatever is the nature of sound, such as pleasure,

original: gang gi phyir nang gi bdag nyid kho nar dga' ba dang gdung ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nang gi bdag nyid kho nar dga' ba dang gdung ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: because it is experienced as pleasure and pain that have the nature of delight and distress only internally,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i bde la sogs pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i bde la sogs pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ma yin pas so //
translated: it is not experienced as the pleasure and pain of sound and so on.

original: 'di ni grangs can pa'i 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs can pa'i 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the assertions of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: bye brag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rdzas la sogs pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rdzas la sogs pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: From the perspective of the Vai≈õe·π£ika, it is like the nonperception of substance and so on.

original: 'di ltar de rnams kyi cha shas las tha dad du gyur pa'i cha shas las 'du ba'i cha shas can khas len pa dang / las kyang 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / bsgrub pa la sogs pas rdzas la tha dad du gyur pa'i mngon sum du 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de rnams kyi cha shas las tha dad du gyur pa'i cha shas las 'du ba'i cha shas can khas len pa dang / las kyang 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / bsgrub pa la sogs pas rdzas la tha dad du gyur pa'i mngon sum du 'dod pa dang /
translated: Thus, they assert that the whole is a different part from its parts, and that action is a different substance from the things that have it, because it is directly perceived to be different in terms of lifting, placing, going, coming, accomplishing, and so on.

original: yod pa @114b nyid la sogs pa'i spyi rdzas las tha dad pa'i mngon sum pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa @114b nyid la sogs pa'i spyi rdzas las tha dad pa'i mngon sum pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: They assert that universals such as existence are directly perceived as different substances.

original: de rnams ni mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
translated: They are not directly perceived.

original: gang zag gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gzhan mngon sum pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gzhan mngon sum pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of the person, a substance that is different from form and so on is not directly perceived.

original: de las tha dad du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de las tha dad du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that which is different from it is not observed.

original: / de ltar mthong ba'i dngos po rnams la mi slu ba nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar mthong ba'i dngos po rnams la mi slu ba nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the things that are seen are undeceiving.

original: de bzhin du rjes dpag gi yul lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la rjes dpag gis de kho na bzhin du grub pa ni mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes dpag gi yul lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la rjes dpag gis de kho na bzhin du grub pa ni mi slu ba ste /
translated: Likewise, with regard to the hidden things that are the objects of inference, the non-deceptive is that which is established just as it is by inference.

original: dper na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, impermanence, etc.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du grub pas rjes su dpag pas mi gnod pa ni mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du grub pas rjes su dpag pas mi gnod pa ni mi slu ba ste /
translated: The non-deceptive is that which is not refuted by inference, being established as not an object of inference, just as it is.

original: dper na gtso bo dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gtso bo dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like prakriti, isvara, etc.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: The dharma that is their nature is not permanent,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because its nature itself is to be established.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it an effect,

original: rtag pa la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: because an effect does not exist in the permanent.

original: de de lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po la rjes su dpag pas mi gnod pas mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: de de lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po la rjes su dpag pas mi gnod pas mi slu ba yin no //
translated: That is non-deceptive with regard to the hidden thing, because it is not refuted by inference.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don yin no snyam nas phyin ci log tu nges pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don yin no snyam nas phyin ci log tu nges pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of emptiness is nonexistence‚Äù means that one who has a mistaken understanding of emptiness thinks that the meaning of emptiness is the denial of cause and effect.

original: dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la skur ba 'debs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa la skur ba 'debs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúDenies all things‚Äù means that one denies cause and effect, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba'i shes rab las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba'i shes rab las /
translated: For this very reason, the Mulaprajna says:

original: gzung bar dka' ba'i sbrul dang ni //
analyzed: gzung bar dka' ba'i sbrul dang ni //
translated: Like a snake that is difficult to seize,

original: @116b legs par ma bsgrubs rig sngags bzhin //
analyzed: @116b legs par ma bsgrubs rig sngags bzhin //
translated: Or a spell that is not properly executed,

original: stong nyid log par rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: stong nyid log par rtogs pa yis //
translated: A mistaken understanding of emptiness

original: blo gros dman pa rlag par byed //
analyzed: blo gros dman pa rlag par byed //
translated: Destroys the unwise.

original: chos 'di blo gros dman pa yis //
analyzed: chos 'di blo gros dman pa yis //
translated: This doctrine is not for the unwise.

original: rtogs par dka' ba mkhyen nas su //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba mkhyen nas su //
translated: Knowing that it is difficult to understand,

original: de bas thub pas chos kyi phyir //
analyzed: de bas thub pas chos kyi phyir //
translated: the Sage, for the sake of the Dharma,

original: thugs ni btang snyoms mdzad pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thugs ni btang snyoms mdzad pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: set aside his compassion.

original: lhag par mos pa'i khyad par nges par byas te zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la mos pa'i khyad par nges par mdzad de zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i khyad par nges par byas te zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la mos pa'i khyad par nges par mdzad de zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving ascertained the distinction of superior aspiration‚Äù is that he ascertained the distinction of superior aspiration for emptiness.

original: nges par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems kyi 'jug pa rtogs par dka' bas so //
analyzed: nges par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems kyi 'jug pa rtogs par dka' bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúDifficult to ascertain‚Äù means that it is difficult to understand the engagement of the minds of others.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i don du'o //üîΩrab tu dga' ba las byung mchi mas mig brlan zhing //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i don du'o // rab tu dga' ba las byung mchi mas mig brlan zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to teach the reason for that‚Äù means in order to teach the reason for the distinction of superior aspiration.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid thos nas dang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid thos nas dang ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHis eyes filled with tears born of joy‚Äù means that he was delighted upon hearing about emptiness.

original: dad pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i mchi mas mig gang ba gang la yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i mchi mas mig gang ba gang la yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTears‚Äù are the moisture born from that faith. ‚ÄúEyes‚Äù are the sense faculty that sees forms. ‚ÄúFilled‚Äù means that they were filled with tears.üîΩ‚ÄúThe Sage, for the sake of the Dharma, set aside his compassion‚Äù means that he set aside his compassion for those who would not understand emptiness.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i mchi ma dang ldan pa'i mig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i mchi ma dang ldan pa'i mig ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: eyes endowed with tears of joy.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: There means in one who is endowed with joy.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas blo'i zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi blo'i sgrib pa thams cad dag pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas blo'i zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi blo'i sgrib pa thams cad dag pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom of the perfect Buddha means the wisdom of the perfect Buddha, which is the purification of all obscurations.

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: enlightenment.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'o ;
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'o ;
translated: Seed means its cause.

original: / des na phyi'i rtags gsum gyi sgo nas stong pa nyid la lhag par mos par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: / des na phyi'i rtags gsum gyi sgo nas stong pa nyid la lhag par mos par shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is known that one who has superior devotion to emptiness through the three outer signs.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: There means the teaching of reality.

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nye bar bstan pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nye bar bstan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Consequent means the cause of the teaching of reality.

original: yon tan 'byung zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: Source of qualities means morality and so on.

original: de mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi lta ba ste mi nyams par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi lta ba ste mi nyams par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: In order not to lose that, means in order not to lose the view of emptiness.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror ltung nas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror ltung nas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Having fallen into miserable realms due to the condition of immorality, means that immorality itself is the cause of going to miserable realms.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod dag ni 'gro ngan na'ang zhes bya ba der  ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod dag ni 'gro ngan na'ang zhes bya ba der  ro //
translated: Wealth is obtained through generosity, even in miserable realms, means that.

original: zas dang sman dang chos gos la sogs pa'i sgras ni mal stan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas dang sman dang chos gos la sogs pa'i sgras ni mal stan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The terms food, medicine, Dharma robes, and so on should be understood to include bedding and so on.

original: snying rjes yongs su zin pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang phyir brtse nyid rgyal ba'i lo tog phun tshogs 'di'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan no //
analyzed: snying rjes yongs su zin pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang phyir brtse nyid rgyal ba'i lo tog phun tshogs 'di'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan no //
translated: Compassion is the seed of the Victor‚Äôs perfect harvest, and so on.

original: kha dog ngan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog ngan pa kho bas so zhes gsungs @117a * //
analyzed: kha dog ngan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog ngan pa kho bas so zhes gsungs @117a * //
translated: It causes the attainment of an ugly color, means it causes an ugly color.

original: pas so ; / de'i rkyen gyis zhes bya ba ni kha dog ngan pa'i rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: pas so ; / de'i rkyen gyis zhes bya ba ni kha dog ngan pa'i rkyen gyis so //
translated: By that condition means by the condition of bad color.

original: 'bras bu dpag tu med pa rnam pa chad pa med par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dpag tu med pa rnam pa chad pa med par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is immeasurable and uninterrupted means that the giving of giving, etc. dedicated to Buddhahood is inexhaustible.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub nyid du sngo bar byed ce na de'i phyir 'gro ba dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub nyid du sngo bar byed ce na de'i phyir 'gro ba dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is it dedicated to enlightenment itself? Therefore, it is said, for the sake of liberating beings.

original: sangs rgyas su gyur nas 'gro ba rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gyur nas 'gro ba rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having become a Buddha, one should liberate beings.

original: da ni de kho na nyid bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to state the special result of teaching reality,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: thus, etc. is stated.

original: yun ring por bar chad med par dge ba'i tshogs gdon mi za bar bsags par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por bar chad med par dge ba'i tshogs gdon mi za bar bsags par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having accumulated the collection of virtue uninterruptedly for a long time without doubt, means that the collection is the stage of devoted engagement.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i tshul la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la ste /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i tshul la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la ste /
translated: The phrase in the manner of the profound and the vast refers to the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po'i don dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can grub pa'i don ston pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po'i don dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can grub pa'i don ston pas so //
translated: The word profound refers to the teaching of the emptiness of all things, and the word vast refers to the teaching of the generosity, etc.

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyis dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyis dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pas so //
translated: The phrase in stages refers to the stages of the accumulations and the stage of the practice of firm conviction.

original: lam 'di zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ston pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: lam 'di zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ston pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The phrase on this path refers to the path that has the nature of revealing reality.

original: de la de kho na nyid ni gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / chos kyi bdag med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid ni gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / chos kyi bdag med pa la bya'o //
translated: The word reality here refers to the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of things.

original: de yang 'dir lung dang rigs pas bsgrub par bstan pa yin pas de la lung gis bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde la chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang 'dir lung dang rigs pas bsgrub par bstan pa yin pas de la lung gis bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since it is taught that this reality is established by both scripture and reasoning, the following verse is stated to demonstrate its establishment by scripture.üîΩThe verse states: The Bhagavat has said that the reality of things is not an object of the intellect.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The word reality here means thatness.

original: sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa la 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pas so ;
analyzed: sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa la 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pas so ;
translated: On the fifth ground, the path is called ‚Äúextremely complete‚Äù because the path characterized by the perfection of meditative stabilization that enters the sixth ground is complete.

original: /'di'i don ni sa drug par shes rab shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: /'di'i don ni sa drug par shes rab shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that on the sixth ground, wisdom becomes extremely superior.

original: de yang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis yin te /
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is due to the power of meditative stabilization.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: It is said that through mental stabilization, one knows reality just as it is.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos te /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos te /
translated: The equality of phenomena is the phenomena

original: phung po dang / khams dang ; skye mched rnams mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang ; skye mched rnams mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: of the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres, because they are equal in being the nature of signlessness and so on.

original: mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang kun du brtags pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba spros pa med pa chos kyi dbyings de mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang kun du brtags pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba spros pa med pa chos kyi dbyings de mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The sameness of the signless means that the reality realm, which is free from the conceptual thought of the imagined and is free from mental fabrication, is signless.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams @117b cad kyi yul ma yin pas so //üîΩdes na chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams @117b cad kyi yul ma yin pas so // des na chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not the object of any conceptual consciousness.üîΩTherefore, all phenomena are said to be signless.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because all phenomena have the nature of the consummate, they are the sameness of the signless.

original: mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang kun tu brtags pa'i brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi chos de thams cad shin tu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid des mtshan nyid med pa yin pas mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang kun tu brtags pa'i brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi chos de thams cad shin tu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid des mtshan nyid med pa yin pas mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSameness in the absence of characteristics‚Äù means that all phenomena which have the nature of the imagined, i.e., the object of expression and the means of expression, which have the aspect of the grasped and the grasper, are utterly nonexistent. Therefore, because of the absence of the imagined characteristic, there is sameness in the absence of characteristics.

original: skye ba med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin can de rang gi bdag nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin can de rang gi bdag nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSameness in the absence of origination‚Äù means that which has the nature of the ultimate, the perfected, is the same in the absence of origination, because it does not originate by itself.

original: de nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the same in the absence of origination, because it is not generated by causes and conditions.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba yin pas na dben par mnyam pa nyid do //üîΩgdod ma nas rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de nyid la sngar skye ba med pas tha mar chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa yin pas gdod ma nas rnam par dag par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba yin pas na dben par mnyam pa nyid do // gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de nyid la sngar skye ba med pas tha mar chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa yin pas gdod ma nas rnam par dag par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Since the nature of reality itself is free from conceptual elaborations, all phenomena are free from conceptual elaborations, and so they are the same in being free from conceptual elaborations.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all views, all phenomena are free from all views, and so they are the same in being free from all views.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all conceptual thoughts, all phenomena are free from all conceptual thoughts, and so they are the same in being free from all conceptual thoughts.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the afflictions, all phenomena are free from all the afflictions, and so they are the same in being free from all the afflictions.

original: spros pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyi 'dzin par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa la spros pa med pas nges gzung bar bya ba'i chos thams cad la spros pa med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdes na spros pa med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyi 'dzin par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa la spros pa med pas nges gzung bar bya ba'i chos thams cad la spros pa med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdes na spros pa med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Since the nature of reality itself is free from all the defilements, all phenomena are free from all the defilements, and so they are the same in being free from all the defilements.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the secondary defilements, all phenomena are free from all the secondary defilements, and so they are the same in being free from all the secondary defilements.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the entanglements, all phenomena are free from all the entanglements, and so they are the same in being free from all the entanglements.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the bonds, all phenomena are free from all the bonds, and so they are the same in being free from all the bonds.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the fetters, all phenomena are free from all the fetters, and so they are the same in being free from all the fetters.üîΩSince the nature of reality itself is free from all the obscurations, all phenomena are free from all the obscurations, and so they are the same in being free from all the obscurations.

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin de nyid la bya ba med pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du phung po gzhan yongs su dor ba dang / phung po gzhan len pa don dam par med pas blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i phyir blang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin de nyid la bya ba med pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du phung po gzhan yongs su dor ba dang / phung po gzhan len pa don dam par med pas blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i phyir blang ba med pa dang /
translated: The equality of non-appropriation and non-rejection refers to the ultimate nature, because there is no activity in it. Since the rejection of one set of aggregates in another birth and the appropriation of another set of aggregates do not exist ultimately, there is no appropriation and no rejection.

original: dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the equality of non-appropriation and non-rejection.

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni de la sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa'i dngos po rnams sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni de la sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa'i dngos po rnams sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: All phenomena are like an illusion refers to the equality of all things included in the world of sentient beings and the physical world with an illusion.

original: sgyu mas sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa bzhin du med pa la yod pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu mas sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa bzhin du med pa la yod pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like an elephant conjured up by an illusion, they appear to exist, although they do not exist.

original: yul la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rmi lam dang mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: yul la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rmi lam dang mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the enjoyment of objects is equal to a dream.

original: snying po med pa la mngon par chags pa skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po med pa la mngon par chags pa skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of attachment to what is essenceless is like a magical creation.

original: @118a * // lus kyi las kyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi mig yor dang mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: @118a * // lus kyi las kyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi mig yor dang mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The nature of physical karma is like a reflection,

original: chos thams cad bya ba med pa nyid du zin kyang mig yor bzhin du lus kyi bya ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad bya ba med pa nyid du zin kyang mig yor bzhin du lus kyi bya ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because although all phenomena are devoid of activity, physical activity appears like a reflection.

original: brag ca dang zhes bya ba ni ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin can rnams brag ca dang mnyam pa nyid do //

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩde las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason refuting arising from self, he says:üîΩIn this way,üîΩfrom that,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: that,

original: yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: no quality whatsoever.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan lhag pa cung zad kyang skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan lhag pa cung zad kyang skye ba med pas so //
translated: This means that since not even the slightest superior quality arises,

original: des na rang las skye ba mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang las skye ba mi srid pa'o //
translated: therefore arising from self is impossible.

original: 'di'i don ni gang gi tshe rang nyid las rang nyid skye na de'i tshe rgyu'i rang bzhin la khyad par med pas 'bras bu'i rang bzhin skye ba'am khyad par dang bcas par skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang gi tshe rang nyid las rang nyid skye na de'i tshe rgyu'i rang bzhin la khyad par med pas 'bras bu'i rang bzhin skye ba'am khyad par dang bcas par skye bar 'gyur /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: When something is produced from itself, then since there is no difference in the nature of the cause, the nature of the effect would be produced either with a difference or without a difference.

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni rang bzhin sngar yod pa'i phyir skye ba med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni rang bzhin sngar yod pa'i phyir skye ba med par mi rigs so //
translated: If it is the first case, then since the nature already exists, it is not logical that it is produced.

original: gal te gnyis pa ltar na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te gnyis pa ltar na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If it is the second case, that also is not logical.

original: khyad par med pa las khyad par dang bcas par skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa las khyad par dang bcas par skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If something with a difference were produced from something without a difference,

original: sngar khyad par med pas rang las skye ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: sngar khyad par med pas rang las skye ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: then it would not be logical for something to be produced from itself, since previously there was no difference.

original: des na gal te yon tan yod par 'gyur na rang las skyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na gal te yon tan yod par 'gyur na rang las skyes par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if the quality existed, it would be produced from itself.

original: yon tan med pas rang la skye ba srid pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan med pas rang la skye ba srid pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But since the quality does not exist, it is impossible for it to be produced from itself.

original: de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po ste zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthat now arising‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which is the agent of the action of arising.‚Äù

original: 'dir gang skye bzhin pa de skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang skye bzhin pa de skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po yin te /
translated: Here, that which is now arising is the agent of the action of arising.

original: dper na 'gro ba de 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba de 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, that which is going is the agent of the action of going.

original: sa bon ni byed pa po 'jug par byed pa yin te /üîΩdper na lha sbyin gyis 'gro @120a * //
analyzed: sa bon ni byed pa po 'jug par byed pa yin te / dper na lha sbyin gyis 'gro @120a * //
translated: The seed is the agent that causes the sprout to come into existence.

original: ba'i bya ba la gzhan 'jug par byed pa po yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba'i bya ba la gzhan 'jug par byed pa po yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, Devadatta is the agent that causes Yaj√±adatta to go.

original: des na myu gu nyid skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po'o //
analyzed: des na myu gu nyid skye ba'i bya ba byed pa po'o //
translated: Therefore, the sprout itself is the agent of the action of arising.

original: skye bzhin pa de nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba ni myu gu las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa de nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba ni myu gu las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is now arising is from its own self, that is, from the sprout.

original: de ltar na bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di ni srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di ni srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, this position that things arise from themselves is not possible.

original: / da ni srid du zin kyang rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / da ni srid du zin kyang rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag las skye ba'i phyogs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that even if [the opponent] accepts [the existence of the sprout], it is still contradictory to reason, [the root text] states, ‚ÄúIn this position of arising from self . . .‚Äù

original: rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal bas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal bas so zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of reason‚Äù means in terms of contradiction with direct perception.

original: skyes zin zhes bya ba ni 'di yang thal 'gyur ston pa yin te ;
analyzed: skyes zin zhes bya ba ni 'di yang thal 'gyur ston pa yin te ;
translated: ‚ÄúHaving already arisen‚Äù is also a reductio argument.

original: gal te skyes zin pa slar skye bar rtog na /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa slar skye bar rtog na /
translated: If one conceives that which has already arisen to arise again,

original: de'i tshe myu gu la sogs pa rnams skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe myu gu la sogs pa rnams skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then sprouts and so on would not arise.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas myu gu la sogs pa skye bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas myu gu la sogs pa skye bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: From the perspective of the world, sprouts and so on are seen to arise.

original: de'i phyir rang las skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang las skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising from self does not exist.

original: 'di'i don ni rang las skye'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rang las skye'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. In the statement ‚Äúarising from self,‚Äù

original: sa bon las sa bon skye ba yin gyi myu gu la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon las sa bon skye ba yin gyi myu gu la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is a seed arising from a seed, not a sprout and so on.

original: gal te myu gu la sogs pa skye ba khas len na sa bon dang myu gu mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te myu gu la sogs pa skye ba khas len na sa bon dang myu gu mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that such things as sprouts arise, then you accept that they arise from other, because seeds and sprouts are different.

original: des na gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs khas len pa la 'jigs pas sa bon nyid las sa bon skye bar khas len na myu gu la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs khas len pa la 'jigs pas sa bon nyid las sa bon skye bar khas len na myu gu la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the fear of accepting the position that things arise from other, if you accept that a seed arises from a seed itself, then a sprout would not arise.

original: 'dir thal 'gyur gyi mtshan nyid ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i sgo nas gzhan la mi 'dod pa ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir thal 'gyur gyi mtshan nyid ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i sgo nas gzhan la mi 'dod pa ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here, the definition of a reductio pertains to the demonstration to another of what is unacceptable by means of what the other accepts.

original: dper na gzhan gyi bdag las bdag skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po khas len na myu gu la sogs pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes mi 'dod pa rjod par byed pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi bdag las bdag skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po khas len na myu gu la sogs pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes mi 'dod pa rjod par byed pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if one accepts that things have the characteristic of arising from themselves, then such things as sprouts would not arise. This is the demonstration of what is unacceptable.

original: de la 'ga' zhig na re gal te thal 'gyur gtan tshigs su 'dod na tshad mas grub pa yin nam /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig na re gal te thal 'gyur gtan tshigs su 'dod na tshad mas grub pa yin nam /
translated: In this regard, someone might say this: If you accept that a reductio is a logical reason, then is it established by a valid cognition?

original: 'on te ma grub pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa yin /
translated: Or is it not established?

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe gnyis ka la grub pa yin pas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe gnyis ka la grub pa yin pas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: In response to this, if it is the first possibility, then since it is established for both, how could it be said to be ‚Äúaccepted by the other‚Äù?

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar gzhan gyis khas len par mi 'os pa yin pas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar gzhan gyis khas len par mi 'os pa yin pas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: In the second case, since it is not suitable for the other to accept it, how could it be said to be ‚Äúaccepted by the other‚Äù?

original: de la lan ni tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka la grub pa yin no zhes pa de nyid kho bos mi shes te /üîΩ'di ltar rgol bas sgrub byed bkod pa'i @120b dus na gtan tshigs 'god pa de la tshad mas grub pa yin grang /
analyzed: de la lan ni tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka la grub pa yin no zhes pa de nyid kho bos mi shes te / 'di ltar rgol bas sgrub byed bkod pa'i @120b dus na gtan tshigs 'god pa de la tshad mas grub pa yin grang /
translated: The response to that is this: I do not know that which is established by valid knowledge is established for both.

original: gzhan la tshad mas grub par des ci ltar shes te /
analyzed: gzhan la tshad mas grub par des ci ltar shes te /
translated: Thus, when the proponent sets forth a proof, how does he know that the statement of the reason is established by valid knowledge for the other?

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi khyad par mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi khyad par mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific mental states of others are not objects of direct perception or inference.

original: rang nyid la yang tshad mas grub par ci ltar shes te /
analyzed: rang nyid la yang tshad mas grub par ci ltar shes te /
translated: How does he know that it is established by valid knowledge for himself?

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis dus ring po nas bzung ba'i phyir slu ba 'drid pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis dus ring po nas bzung ba'i phyir slu ba 'drid pas so //
translated: Because of the cause of error, it has been long since we have been deceived by the deceptive.

original: de phyir rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag gis tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de phyir rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag gis tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas len pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the acceptance of valid cognition by both parties in a debate, the nature of things is accepted.

original: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin par rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to refute the position of the opponent by means of what the opponent accepts.

original: gzhan yang rang rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyi phyogs la gal te gtan tshigs dang / bsgrub par bya ba dag la tshad mas khyab pa grub na de'i tshe rang rgyud sgrub byed du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyi phyogs la gal te gtan tshigs dang / bsgrub par bya ba dag la tshad mas khyab pa grub na de'i tshe rang rgyud sgrub byed du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, with regard to the position of autonomous reasoning, if the pervasion of the reason and the predicate were established by valid cognition, then it would be an autonomous proof.

original: 'on kyang khyab pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyab pa ma grub ste /
translated: However, the pervasion is not established.

original: 'di ltar khyab bsgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyab bsgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the valid cognition that establishes the pervasion is either direct perception or inference.

original: de la re zhig mngon sum gyis khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig mngon sum gyis khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: In that regard, first, the pervasion is not established by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar tshang bar du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis me dang du bdag la /üîΩ'di yod na 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshang bar du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis me dang du bdag la / 'di yod na 'di 'byung la /
translated: In this way, until the fire is extinguished, direct perception and non-observation establish that if this exists, that arises.üîΩ

original: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ba rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ba rtogs kyi /
translated: In this way, until the fire and smoke are seen together, direct perception and non-apprehension ascertain that when this exists, that arises and when this does not exist, that does not arise.

original: yul thams cad la yod pa ni ma yin no ;üîΩ/ rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul thams cad la yod pa ni ma yin no ; / rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for all objects.

original: de yang yul nges pa can yin pas so //üîΩ'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni thams cad ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yul nges pa can yin pas so // 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni thams cad ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by inference, because inference has a limited scope.

original: gang gi phyir gang na bsgrub par bya ba dang 'grel pa'i rtags yod pa de kho na mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang na bsgrub par bya ba dang 'grel pa'i rtags yod pa de kho na mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The object of inference is not everything, because the cognition of impermanence and so on arises only where the reason that proves it exists,

original: yul dang dus thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: but not everywhere and always.

original: des na 'jig rten pas khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas khyab pa grub pa yin gyi tshad mas ni ma yin pas thal 'gyur gyi gtan tshigs kyis gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ci ltar mi rigs she'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pas khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas khyab pa grub pa yin gyi tshad mas ni ma yin pas thal 'gyur gyi gtan tshigs kyis gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ci ltar mi rigs she'o //
translated: Therefore, pervasion is established by mere acceptance of the world, not by valid knowledge. Thus, how could it be illogical to refute the position of others by a reductio argument?

original: de ltar yang slob dpon rang nyid kyis dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi bshad pa tshig don gsal ba las /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon rang nyid kyis dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi bshad pa tshig don gsal ba las /
translated: In the same way, the master himself says in the Prasannapadii, the commentary to the Mulamadhyamaka-karika:

original: gal te dngos po rnams bdag la mi skye ba kho na yin no zhes nges gzung du byed na gzhan las skye ba yin par mi 'dod kyang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams bdag la mi skye ba kho na yin no zhes nges gzung du byed na gzhan las skye ba yin par mi 'dod kyang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one were to take the position that things do not arise from themselves alone, then, even though one does not accept that they arise from others, it would follow that they do.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa dang / gzhan las skye ba 'gegs par 'gyur bas so //üîΩslob @121a * //
analyzed: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa dang / gzhan las skye ba 'gegs par 'gyur bas so // slob @121a * //
translated: Since it is a statement of nonexistence, it is a negation of arising from another.

original: dpon sangs rgyas skyong gis dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dpon sangs rgyas skyong gis dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The master Buddhapalita says that things do not arise from themselves,

original: de skye ba don med pa dang / thug pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skye ba don med pa dang / thug pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because their arising would be pointless and because there would be an infinite regress.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa'i dngos po rnams kyang skye ba la dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa'i dngos po rnams kyang skye ba la dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Things that exist by virtue of their own nature do not need to arise again.

original: gal te yod du zin kyang skye na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te yod du zin kyang skye na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If they did arise again, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de la kha cig gis skyon brjod pa 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la kha cig gis skyon brjod pa 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some say: This criticism is illogical.

original: gtan tshigs dang / dpe ma brjod pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon ma spangs pa dang / thal 'gyur gyi ngag yin pa'i phyir skabs su bab pa'i don las zlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i gtan tshigs gsal bar 'gyur bas skye ba don dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang / dpe ma brjod pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon ma spangs pa dang / thal 'gyur gyi ngag yin pa'i phyir skabs su bab pa'i don las zlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i gtan tshigs gsal bar 'gyur bas skye ba don dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Because it is a reductio argument, it does not state a reason and example, it does not avoid the errors to be explained below, and it does not clearly state the opposite of the proposition and its reason, it establishes that arising has a point.

original: skye ba thug pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar bsgrubs pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: skye ba thug pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar bsgrubs pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: And because it establishes that things arise from other by the reason that arising is not infinite, it contradicts our own tenets.

original: kho bos skyon 'di thams cad 'byung bar mi 'thad par mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: kho bos skyon 'di thams cad 'byung bar mi 'thad par mthong ba yin te /
translated: We see no fault in any of this.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de ltar re zhig gang gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma brjod pa dang zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gang gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma brjod pa dang zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is illogical to say that it does not state a reason and example.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis rang las skye ba khas len na yod pa nyid yang skye ba la dogs pa dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis rang las skye ba khas len na yod pa nyid yang skye ba la dogs pa dri bar bya ste /
translated: Because if you accept arising from self, then you should be asked whether or not that which exists is produced.

original: rang las skye zhes pas ni rgyu nyid du yod pa de nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rang las skye zhes pas ni rgyu nyid du yod pa de nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarises from itself‚Äù means that that which exists as the cause itself is produced.

original: zhes khyod kyis brjod la /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis brjod la /
translated: You say this.

original: yod pa nyid la yang skye ba dogs pa ma mthong ba dang / thug pa med par 'gyur ba yang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid la yang skye ba dogs pa ma mthong ba dang / thug pa med par 'gyur ba yang mthong ba yin no //
translated: But we see no need for that which exists to be produced again, and we see that there would be an infinite regress.

original: khyod kyis skyes pa yang skye bar mi 'dod pa dang / thug pa med par yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis skyes pa yang skye bar mi 'dod pa dang / thug pa med par yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: You do not assert that that which has arisen arises again, nor do you assert that there is an infinite regress.

original: des na khyod kyis rgol ba de la rigs pa med pa dang ; rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes /
analyzed: des na khyod kyis rgol ba de la rigs pa med pa dang ; rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes /
translated: Therefore, you should be asked whether your argument is not reasonable and whether it contradicts your own beliefs.

original: de ltar phyir brgal na gzhan gyis khas mi len par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar phyir brgal na gzhan gyis khas mi len par 'gyur ram /
translated: If you are challenged in this way, will you not accept the consequence of your position?

original: gang gis gtan tshigs dang dpe brjod pa dogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis gtan tshigs dang dpe brjod pa dogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: And by what means will you avoid the fault of having to state a reason and an example?

original: gal te khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon brjod du zin kyang gzhan dag mi ldog na de'i tshe ngo tsha med pa nyid la gtan tshigs dang dpe brjod pas kyang ldog par mi 'gyur bas smyon pa dang kho bo cag brtsad par rigs pa ma yin no
