original: ci ltar 'grub par gyur pa smos //
analyzed: ci ltar 'grub par gyur pa smos //
translated: be established for you?

original: gal te tshad ma'i stobs kyis don de dang de ste gzhal bya grub pa de ste gzhal bya rnams grub par 'dod na ci ltar tshad mas gzhal bya grub pa de bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung dang / nye bar 'jal ba ste tshad ma bzhi po rnams gang gis grub /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i stobs kyis don de dang de ste gzhal bya grub pa de ste gzhal bya rnams grub par 'dod na ci ltar tshad mas gzhal bya grub pa de bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung dang / nye bar 'jal ba ste tshad ma bzhi po rnams gang gis grub /
translated: If you assert that those objects are established by the power of valid knowledge, then just as those objects of comprehension are established, in the same way, by what are the four valid cognitions‚Äîdirect perception, inference, scriptural testimony, and analogy‚Äîestablished?

original: gal te tshad ma gtan la 'bebs par byed pa la tshad ma gzhan khas mi len na tshad ma med par dngos po rnams mi 'grub po zhes dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma gtan la 'bebs par byed pa la tshad ma gzhan khas mi len na tshad ma med par dngos po rnams mi 'grub po zhes dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If you do not accept other valid cognitions to establish valid cognitions, then you have undermined your own thesis that things are not established without valid cognitions.

original: gal te tshad ma gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma gzhan dag gis //
translated: If they are established by other valid cognitions,

original: 'grub na thug med thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'grub na thug med thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then it follows that there is an infinite regress.

original: de la thog ma dbus dang mtha' //
analyzed: de la thog ma dbus dang mtha' //
translated: In that case, the beginning, middle, and end

original: grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: would not be established.

original: gal te 'di snyam du tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhal bya grub pa'i tshad ma de rnams gzhan gyis grub na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhal bya grub pa'i tshad ma de rnams gzhan gyis grub na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that if those valid cognitions that establish objects of comprehension are established by other valid cognitions, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: gal te thug pa med par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: gal te thug pa med par 'gyur grang /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no infinite regress,‚Äù

original: skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: what is the error?

original: lan ni thog ma grub pa med de /
analyzed: lan ni thog ma grub pa med de /
translated: The response is that the beginning is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshad ma de rnams de las gzhan pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang / de yang gzhan gyis yin pas 'di la thog ma med pa'i phyir dbus dang mtha' dag la yod /
analyzed: tshad ma de rnams de las gzhan pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang / de yang gzhan gyis yin pas 'di la thog ma med pa'i phyir dbus dang mtha' dag la yod /
translated: Because those valid cognitions are established by valid cognitions that are other than them, and those are established by others, so there is no beginning to this. Therefore the middle and end are also not established.

original: des na tshad ma 'di rnams la tshad ma gzhan gyis grub pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma 'di rnams la tshad ma gzhan gyis grub pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for these valid cognitions to be established by other valid cognitions.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin pas //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin pas //
translated: If they are established by invalid cognitions,

original: de rnams 'grub na rtsod pa zad //
analyzed: de rnams 'grub na rtsod pa zad //
translated: then the dispute is over.

original: de dag mi mtshungs pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: de dag mi mtshungs pa nyid kyis //
translated: Since they are not similar,

original: khyad par gyi ni rtags brjod dgos //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ni rtags brjod dgos //
translated: you must state a reason for the distinction.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tshad mas grub la 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tshad mas grub la 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúSome are established by valid cognitions and some are not,‚Äù

original: de yang mi 'thad de /üîΩrgyu mtshan gang gis 'ga' zhig tshad mas grub la /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de / rgyu mtshan gang gis 'ga' zhig tshad mas grub la /
translated: that is also untenable.

original: 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod dgos pa la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod dgos pa la /
translated: You must state a reason for the distinction that proves why some are established by valid cognitions and some are not.

original: de yang ma bstan to //
analyzed: de yang ma bstan to //
translated: But that is not presented.

original: des rtogs pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des rtogs pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this understanding is also unreasonable.

original: de la 'ga' zhig lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to that, someone might say,

original: 'dir tshad ma gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir tshad ma gnyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúHere there are two valid cognitions:

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: direct perception and inference.

original: de yang @128b mngon sum ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang @128b mngon sum ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, direct perception is twofold:

original: don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pas snang ba dang / don gyi bya ba snang ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pas snang ba dang / don gyi bya ba snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of the object is the appearance of the object's function.

original: de la dang po ni thag ring po na me snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni thag ring po na me snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is the appearance of fire at a distance.

original: gnyis pa ni me'i bya ba sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni me'i bya ba sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second is the experience of the function of fire, such as cooking.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: Inference is ascertained as valid knowledge in regard to itself,

original: 'brel pa yod pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from a reason that has a relation.

original: 'di ltar gal te der me med par gyur na du ba yang yod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te der me med par gyur na du ba yang yod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, if fire were absent there, smoke would not exist.

original: gal te du ba med par gyur na du ba mi rtogs pa dang / du ba nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te du ba med par gyur na du ba mi rtogs pa dang / du ba nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If smoke were absent, one would not cognize smoke, and one would not ascertain smoke.

original: des na me shes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na me shes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one would not cognize fire.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa yod pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa yod pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, inference that arises from a reason that has a relation is ascertained as valid knowledge in regard to itself.

original: sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyi bya ba snang ba'i mngon sum ni rang nyid las tshad mar grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyi bya ba snang ba'i mngon sum ni rang nyid las tshad mar grub pa yin te /
translated: The direct perception that appears to the object's action, which is characterized by the experience of burning and so on, is established as valid cognition by itself.

original: don gyi bya ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe 'di don gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom 'ga' zhig la yang mi skye bas so //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe 'di don gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom 'ga' zhig la yang mi skye bas so //
translated: When the object's action is experienced, no doubt whatsoever arises, such as, Is this the object's action or not?

original: don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa snang ba'i mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rgyu gnyis la skyes ba yin te /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa snang ba'i mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rgyu gnyis la skyes ba yin te /
translated: The consciousness of direct perception that appears to accomplish the object's action arises from two causes.

original: goms pa dang ma goms pa dag la'o //
analyzed: goms pa dang ma goms pa dag la'o //
translated: [It arises] from those who are habituated and those who are not.

original: de la gang don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i snang ba goms pa dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skye ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma nyid du rang las nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gang don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i snang ba goms pa dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skye ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma nyid du rang las nges pa yin te /
translated: Among them, that which arises in the continuum of one who is habituated to the appearance that accomplishes the object's action is established as valid cognition by itself,

original: 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa ma yin pa dag rang nyid kyis nges par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa ma yin pa dag rang nyid kyis nges par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because one ascertains whether it is mistaken or not mistaken by oneself.

original: dper na nor bu rtog mkhan gyis nor bu bcos pa dang bcos pa ma yin pa nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nor bu rtog mkhan gyis nor bu bcos pa dang bcos pa ma yin pa nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the person who knows jewels ascertaining whether or not a jewel is a fake.

original: gang don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i snang ba ma goms pa'i rgyud la skye ba de la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom skyed zin kyang /
analyzed: gang don gyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i snang ba ma goms pa'i rgyud la skye ba de la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom skyed zin kyang /
translated: In the continuum of one who has not become accustomed to the appearance that accomplishes the activity of the object, even though doubt has arisen, thinking, ‚ÄúIs it true or not?‚Äù

original: dus phyis don gyi bya ba'i shes pa skyes na the tshom ldog pas tshad ma nyid gzhan las nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis don gyi bya ba'i shes pa skyes na the tshom ldog pas tshad ma nyid gzhan las nges pa yin no //
translated: Later, when the consciousness that accomplishes the activity of the object arises, the doubt is eliminated. Therefore, valid knowledge is ascertained from another.

original: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it lead to an infinite regress.

original: don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom zag med pas so //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom zag med pas so //
translated: Because the doubt that thinks, ‚ÄúIs the consciousness that accomplishes the activity of the object true or not?‚Äù is eliminated.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gang smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gang smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the fault that you have stated, ‚ÄúIf it is the other valid knowledge,‚Äù and so on, is not correct.

original: gal te don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la yang bden pa dang mi bden pa'i the tshom skyed pa yod de /
analyzed: gal te don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la yang bden pa dang mi bden pa'i the tshom skyed pa yod de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn the consciousness that accomplishes the activity of the object, there is also the arising of doubt, thinking, ‚ÄòIs it true or not?‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rmi lam na yang don gyi bya ba'i shes pa yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam na yang don gyi bya ba'i shes pa yod la /
translated: Because in a dream, too, there is the consciousness that accomplishes the activity of the object.

original: sad pa'i @129a * //
analyzed: sad pa'i @129a * //
translated: And it exists in the waking state as well.

original: gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i phyir ci ltar rmi lam na don gyi bya ba med pa la don gyi bya ba'i shes pa skyes pa de bzhin du 'dir yang don gyi bya ba med pas don gyi bya ba'i shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i phyir ci ltar rmi lam na don gyi bya ba med pa la don gyi bya ba'i shes pa skyes pa de bzhin du 'dir yang don gyi bya ba med pas don gyi bya ba'i shes pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, just as in a dream, a consciousness of an object‚Äôs function arises in the absence of an object‚Äôs function, so too in this waking state, a consciousness of an object‚Äôs function arises in the absence of an object‚Äôs function.üîΩOr is it that it exists?

original: 'on te yod pa yin zhes the tshom skyes pas tshad ma gzhan btsal dgos pas na /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa yin zhes the tshom skyes pas tshad ma gzhan btsal dgos pas na /
translated: Since doubt arises, another valid cognition must be sought.

original: thug pa med par thal ba'i skyon gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal ba'i skyon gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the error of infinite regress ensues.

original: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond to that:

original: rmi lam na mthong ba dang / sad pa'i dus kyi don gyi bya ba la khyad par yod pas rmi lam du mthong ba de don gyi bya ba ma yin pas rmi lam du mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba'i shes pas the tshom skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam na mthong ba dang / sad pa'i dus kyi don gyi bya ba la khyad par yod pas rmi lam du mthong ba de don gyi bya ba ma yin pas rmi lam du mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba'i shes pas the tshom skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Since there is a difference between what is seen in a dream and the object‚Äôs function in the waking state, the object seen in a dream is not an object‚Äôs function. Therefore, doubt does not arise due to the consciousness of an object‚Äôs function that sees an object in a dream.

original: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni mthun par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni mthun par snang ba yin te /
translated: In this way, the object‚Äôs function that exists in the waking state is a concordant appearance.

original: yul de na gnas pa'i gzhan rnams kyis kyang dmigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: yul de na gnas pa'i gzhan rnams kyis kyang dmigs pa yin pas so //
translated: because other people who are in that place also perceive it.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba ni mthun par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba ni mthun par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: What is seen in a dream is not a common appearance,

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i skyes bu de nyid kyis mthong bas so //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i skyes bu de nyid kyis mthong bas so //
translated: because that very person who sees in a dream does not see it.

original: des na mthun par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba ni don gyi bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na mthun par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba ni don gyi bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because it is not a common appearance, what is seen in a dream is not a real object.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba yul ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba yul ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the object of a dream is not a real object, because its place is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar yul b'a r'a na s'i na don gyi bya ba dmigs pa'i dus de nyid na yul gzhan du yang dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul b'a r'a na s'i na don gyi bya ba dmigs pa'i dus de nyid na yul gzhan du yang dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, at the very time that the object of a dream is perceived, it is perceived in another place as well.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba ma nges pa nyid du mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba ma nges pa nyid du mi dmigs pas so //
translated: And so, because the object of a dream is not perceived as being in an ascertained place even in the waking state,

original: des na rmi lam gyi dus na mthong ba'i don bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi dus na mthong ba'i don bya ba ma yin no //
translated: therefore, the object seen in a dream is not a real object.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba ni 'bad pa med par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba ni 'bad pa med par grub pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the object of a dream is not a real object, because it is accomplished without effort.

original: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi so nam dang / tshong byed pa la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol chen pos bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi so nam dang / tshong byed pa la sogs pa'i 'bad rtsol chen pos bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba 'grub pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the activity of eating and drinking is accomplished by the great effort of farming, trading, and so on, in the waking state.

original: rmi lam na ni 'bad rtsol med pas 'grub pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba de don gyi bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam na ni 'bad rtsol med pas 'grub pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba de don gyi bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But in a dream, it is accomplished without effort. Therefore, seeing in a dream is not the activity of an object.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam na mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba ni rdzogs par mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam na mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba ni rdzogs par mi dmigs te /
translated: Moreover, the activity of an object seen in a dream is not observed to be complete.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam na 'khrig pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe sen mo btab pa la sogs pa'i phyis mi mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam na 'khrig pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe sen mo btab pa la sogs pa'i phyis mi mthong la /
translated: Thus, when one experiences the pleasure of sexual intercourse in a dream, one does not see the marks of fingernails and so on afterward.

original: thig le 'dzag pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir don gyi bya ba rdzogs pa ma yin pas de'i don gyi bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thig le 'dzag pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir don gyi bya ba rdzogs pa ma yin pas de'i don gyi bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the mere emission of the seminal fluid is seen, the activity of the object is not complete. Therefore, it is not the activity of an object.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba la rgyun yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba la rgyun yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the activity of an object in a dream does not have a continuum.

original: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na khrus byas te kha zas zos na skra gsher ba'i @129b gnas skabs dang / tshim pa'i gnas skabs yun ring du rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na khrus byas te kha zas zos na skra gsher ba'i @129b gnas skabs dang / tshim pa'i gnas skabs yun ring du rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Thus, when one is awake, if one bathes and eats food, the state of wet hair and the state of being satisfied last for a long time.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na ni de ltar ma yin pas don gyi bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na ni de ltar ma yin pas don gyi bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so in a dream, therefore, it is not a real object.

original: mthun snang min dang ma nges dang // 'bad rtsol med dang ma rdzogs dang // bya ba rjes su ma 'brel phyir //
analyzed: mthun snang min dang ma nges dang // 'bad rtsol med dang ma rdzogs dang // bya ba rjes su ma 'brel phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of a common appearance, the absence of certainty, the absence of effort, the incompleteness, and the lack of connection with the action,

original: rmi lam na snang yod ma yin //
analyzed: rmi lam na snang yod ma yin //
translated: the appearance in a dream is not real.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //üîΩde la gang mthun pa'i snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o // de la gang mthun pa'i snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is the summary verse.üîΩAs for the statement that the appearance in a dream is not a real object because it is not a common appearance, that is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir don gyi bya ba de rmi lam na mthong ba'i skyes bu rnams la thun mong bar snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyi bya ba de rmi lam na mthong ba'i skyes bu rnams la thun mong bar snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: Because the appearance of the object in a dream is not a common appearance for all people, is it not?

original: 'on te sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i skyes bu rnams dang mthun par snang ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i skyes bu rnams dang mthun par snang ba ma yin /
translated: But if it is not in accordance with the appearances of the beings who are awake,

original: gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni de'i mthun snang ma yin pa nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni de'i mthun snang ma yin pa nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: then in the first case, it is not established that it is not in accordance with their appearances,

original: gzhan gyis kyang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others also perceive it.

original: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu rnams kyis mi dmigs pas rmi lam gyi dngos po de brdzun pa yin zer na ;
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu rnams kyis mi dmigs pas rmi lam gyi dngos po de brdzun pa yin zer na ;
translated: If you say that the things of a dream are false because they are not perceived by the beings who are awake,

original: de'i tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the objects of the waking state do not exist, because the beings who are in the dream state do not perceive them.

original: des na mthun snang ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na mthun snang ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the objects of the waking state do not exist because they are not in accordance with appearances.

original: gzhan yang yul ma nges pa'i phyir zhes smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul ma nges pa'i phyir zhes smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is also untenable to say that the objects of the waking state do not exist because their location is indeterminate.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yul ma nges pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yul ma nges pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the waking state, too, one observes the non-ascertainment of objects.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe grang ba la sogs pa 'jug pa de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe grang ba la sogs pa 'jug pa de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: Thus, when cold, etc. are engaged, at that very time,

original: dro ba la sogs pa 'jug pa mthong ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i dus su grang ba la sogs pa yod kyang don gyi bya ba ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin pas 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa 'jug pa mthong ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i dus su grang ba la sogs pa yod kyang don gyi bya ba ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin pas 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: warmth, etc. are seen to be engaged. And when warmth, etc. are engaged, cold, etc. exist, but it is not the case that they do not perform their function. In the same way, it is so in the dream state. What is the contradiction?

original: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi lus gzhan pas yul gzhan 'gro ba la sogs pa la gegs ci yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam gyi lus gzhan pas yul gzhan 'gro ba la sogs pa la gegs ci yod de /
translated: Moreover, what is the obstruction to the other body in a dream going to another place, etc.?

original: gnyid kyi stobs kyis lus khyad par can gzhan skyed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyid kyi stobs kyis lus khyad par can gzhan skyed pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the power of sleep produces another special body.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i gzhan gyi lus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i gzhan gyi lus bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the body of another blessed by a yogi.

original: des na ma nges pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is not ascertained, it is not the case that there is no performance of the function of objects.

original: 'bad rtsol med pa las kyang don gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur te /üîΩgang gi phyir rmi lam na yang zhing rmod pa dang nyo @130a * //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol med pa las kyang don gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur te / gang gi phyir rmi lam na yang zhing rmod pa dang nyo @130a * //
translated: And also, the activity of the object does not not exist without effort.

original: tshong la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshong la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even in a dream, the activity of the object is observed, such as plowing, buying, selling, and so on.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tu 'bad rtsol med pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu 'bad rtsol med pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said that something is to be accomplished without effort,

original: de'i tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: then it is the same in the state of waking.

original: de la yang brgya lam na lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gser srang stong phrag gcig la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba 'bad rtsol med par 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de la yang brgya lam na lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gser srang stong phrag gcig la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba 'bad rtsol med par 'grub pa yin la /
translated: Because even in that state, by the blessing of gods and so on, the activity of the object is accomplished without effort, such as obtaining a thousand ounces of gold and so on.

original: de yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not nonexistent.

original: de bzhin 'dir yang yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir yang yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: And it is the same here.

original: don gyi bya ba ma rdzogs pas kyang don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba ma rdzogs pas kyang don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: And also, the activity of the object does not not exist because the activity of the object is not complete.

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam na don gyi bya ba rdzogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam na don gyi bya ba rdzogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Because the activity of an object is perceived to be complete in a dream,

original: dper na khu ba 'dzag pa bzhin du sen mo'i rjes la sogs pa yang der dmigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dper na khu ba 'dzag pa bzhin du sen mo'i rjes la sogs pa yang der dmigs pa yin pas so //
translated: just as the emission of semen is perceived there, and also the perception of a fingernail and so on.

original: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs na don gyi bya ba rdzogs par mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs na don gyi bya ba rdzogs par mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the activity of an object is not perceived to be complete in the waking state,

original: 'o na sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa de rmi lam na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'o na sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa de rmi lam na mi dmigs te /
translated: then the complete activity of an object in the waking state is not perceived in a dream.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis khrus byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis khrus byas te /
translated: For example, if a man bathes and eats food,

original: kha zas zos na skra gsher ba nyid nyal ba'i rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na bkres pa dang / skra skam po dmigs na don gyi bya ba rdzogs par mi dmigs pas sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang yongs su ma rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas zos na skra gsher ba nyid nyal ba'i rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na bkres pa dang / skra skam po dmigs na don gyi bya ba rdzogs par mi dmigs pas sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi bya ba yang yongs su ma rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the dream state of sleep, when he is hungry and his hair is wet, he perceives his hair to be dry. Since the activity of an object is not perceived to be complete, it follows that the activity of an object in the waking state is also incomplete.

original: des na yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is incomplete, it is not that the activity of an object does not exist.

original: rgyun chags pa ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ma yin pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba med pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that the function of objects does not exist because of non-continuity,

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: because there is continuity in the dream state.

original: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa med pas mi bden pa yin na sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa med pas de yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa med pas mi bden pa yin na sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i don gyi bya ba yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rgyun chags pa med pas de yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not true because there is no continuity in the waking state, then the function of objects seen in the waking state would also not exist because there is no continuity in the dream state.

original: des na rgyun chags pa med pas don gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyun chags pa med pas don gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the function of objects does not not exist because of non-continuity.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi gtan tshigs lngas don gyi bya ba mi mtshungs pa nyid du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi gtan tshigs lngas don gyi bya ba mi mtshungs pa nyid du brjod pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, your five reasons express the non-equivalence of the function of objects.

original: mi mtshungs pa tsam gyis don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa tsam gyis don gyi bya ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: But the non-existence of the function of objects is not due to mere non-equivalence,

original: gnyis ka yang don gyi bya ba nyid du dmigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang don gyi bya ba nyid du dmigs pa yin pas so //
translated: because both are observed to be the function of objects.

original: gal te don gyi bya ba dmigs su zin kyang mi 'dra ba tsam gyis don gyi bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te don gyi bya ba dmigs su zin kyang mi 'dra ba tsam gyis don gyi bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If the object‚Äôs activity is observed, but it is not the object‚Äôs activity because it is merely different,

original: 'o na bum pa dang snam bu dag gis bsgrub par @130b bya ba'i don gyi bya ba yang mi 'dra ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na bum pa dang snam bu dag gis bsgrub par @130b bya ba'i don gyi bya ba yang mi 'dra ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir don gyi bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the object‚Äôs activity that is accomplished by the pot and cloth is not the object‚Äôs activity because it is observed to be different.

original: des na rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi don gyi bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object‚Äôs activity exists in dreams.

original: de la dmigs pa'i don gyi bya ba shes pa bden pa nyid du khyod kyis mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i don gyi bya ba shes pa bden pa nyid du khyod kyis mi 'dod la /
translated: You do not assert that the consciousness that observes it is real.

original: des na don gyi bya ba'i shes pa mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can nyid du yod pas don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la yang bden pa dang mi bden pa'i the tshom dag ldog pa ma yin pas tshad ma gzhan tshol na thug pa med par thal barüîΩ'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na don gyi bya ba'i shes pa mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can nyid du yod pas don gyi bya ba'i shes pa la yang bden pa dang mi bden pa'i the tshom dag ldog pa ma yin pas tshad ma gzhan tshol na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the consciousness of the object‚Äôs activity exists as having an unreal nature, even with respect to the consciousness of the object‚Äôs activity, you do not eliminate the doubts about whether it is real or not real. Therefore, if you seek another valid cognition, it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: des na 'ga' zhig rang las tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig rang las tshad ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if something is a valid cognition in regard to itself,

original: 'ga' zhig gzhan las tshad ma yin no zhes brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gzhan las tshad ma yin no zhes brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: It is not right to say that some are valid cognitions in regard to others.

original: / des na tshad ma ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / des na tshad ma ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because valid cognitions are not established,

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par brjod pa gal yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par brjod pa gal yod ces pa'o //
translated: it is necessary to state their characteristics correctly.

original: de la sems tsam pa rnams na re de ni don gyi bya ba ma yin pa la yang don gyi bya bar dmigs pa'i phyir don bya ba'i shes pa la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom mi ldog pas phyir rol gyi don la shes pa rnams
analyzed: de la sems tsam pa rnams na re de ni don gyi bya ba ma yin pa la yang don gyi bya bar dmigs pa'i phyir don bya ba'i shes pa la bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom mi ldog pas phyir rol gyi don la shes pa rnams
translated: The CittamƒÅtra say, ‚ÄúSince the activity of an object is observed even in the absence of an object, doubt about whether the cognition of the activity of an object is true or false is not eliminated. Therefore, consciousness is a valid cognition in regard to external objects.

original: tshad ma yin grang /
analyzed: tshad ma yin grang /
translated: How could it not be a valid cognition?

original: rang rig pa de ci ltar na tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa de ci ltar na tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: How could reflexive awareness not be a valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar don dang don gyi bya ba dag shes pa las phyi rol na med du zin kyang shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin pas de dag la gsal bar snang ba nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dang don gyi bya ba dag shes pa las phyi rol na med du zin kyang shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin pas de dag la gsal bar snang ba nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: Although objects and the activity of objects do not exist externally to consciousness, they exist in the nature of consciousness, and therefore it is reasonable that they appear clearly to consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa yang yod par ma gyur na gang gi bdag nyid du snang ba yin /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yang yod par ma gyur na gang gi bdag nyid du snang ba yin /
translated: If consciousness did not exist, then what would appear?

original: des na gsal bar snang ba nyid de gzhan du mi rigs par shes pa'i ngo bor grub pas bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom med pas rang rigs pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gsal bar snang ba nyid de gzhan du mi rigs par shes pa'i ngo bor grub pas bden nam mi bden snyam pa'i the tshom med pas rang rigs pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the appearance of clarity is established as the nature of consciousness, there is no doubt that it is real. Thus, only reflexive awareness is a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba dag med na mi 'byung ba'i gnyug ma'i chos gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis yod pa nyid du grub pa'i snang ba tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba dag med na mi 'byung ba'i gnyug ma'i chos gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis yod pa nyid du grub pa'i snang ba tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the intrinsic nature of the appearance of clarity is that it does not occur if there is no appearance, it is established that it exists. Therefore, we say that the appearance is not a valid cognition.

original: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te rang rig pa yod par gyur na de'i tshe de brjod par rigs pa yin pa la rang rig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa yod par gyur na de'i tshe de brjod par rigs pa yin pa la rang rig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If reflexive awareness existed, then it would be reasonable to speak of it. But reflexive awareness does not exist.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid rab tu snang bar byed pa de la rang rig ces brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid rab tu snang bar byed pa de la rang rig ces brjod pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, that which is called ‚Äúreflexive awareness‚Äù is the appearance of itself by itself.

original: gcig la shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gcig la shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for a single thing to have the nature of both consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba ste /
translated: It would follow that the agent and the object would be one, and it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: ral gri'i so de nyid la gcod par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ral gri'i so de nyid la gcod par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is illogical for the edge of a sword to cut itself.

original: gal te @131a * //
analyzed: gal te @131a * //
translated: If you say,

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid can gcig la rang rig pa zhes mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid gsal ba de gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos par gsal bar skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid can gcig la rang rig pa zhes mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid gsal ba de gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos par gsal bar skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWe do not say that a single thing that has the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness is reflexive awareness. Rather, we say that the clarity of that thing‚Äôs own nature is clarity that does not depend on another clarity.‚Äù

original: zhe na / 'o na de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / 'o na de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Then we reply, ‚ÄúIn that case, cause and effect are not established for you,

original: yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin pas so //
analyzed: yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin pas so //
translated: because you would be refuting them.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang rang rig de dngos por gyur pa zhig gam dngos po ma yin pa zhig / re zhig khyod kyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dngos po med par mi 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang rig de dngos por gyur pa zhig gam dngos po ma yin pa zhig / re zhig khyod kyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dngos po med par mi 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, is reflexive awareness a thing or is it not a thing? First, you do not assert that it is not a thing because it has the nature of clarity.

original: gal te dngos po yin na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yin na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a thing, it would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: rtag pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is permanent,

original: rim dang cig car gyis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car gyis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rim dang cig car gyis don byed par 'gal ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rim dang cig car gyis don byed par 'gal ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: If it is impermanent, it is contradictory for it to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that cause and effect are different.

original: des na gsal ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid can du grub pas rang rig tshad mar grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gsal ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid can du grub pas rang rig tshad mar grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is established that it is the nature of a manifest thing, autocognition is not established as a valid knowledge.

original: des na tshad ma ma grub pas tshad ma rnams la bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par gsal bar ci ltar byed /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma grub pas tshad ma rnams la bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par gsal bar ci ltar byed /
translated: Since valid knowledge is not established, how could the definition of a treatise be clearly stated in terms of valid knowledge?

original: des na rtog ge'i mtshan nyid brjod pa don med pa yin no zhes brjod pa de rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rtog ge'i mtshan nyid brjod pa don med pa yin no zhes brjod pa de rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to say that it is pointless to state the definition of logic.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventions of valid knowledge and objects of comprehension are established from the world itself.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa nyid las yin no zhes slob dpon rang nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa nyid las yin no zhes slob dpon rang nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The master himself has clearly stated that the conventions of valid cognition and invalid cognition are due to the world itself.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go /
translated: Let us stop this digression.

original: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we will discuss the topic at hand.

original: de ltar rang las skye bar 'dod pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang las skye bar 'dod pa bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the assertion that things arise from themselves,

original: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa'i don du phyogs snga ma dgod pa ni /üîΩ'dir dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa'i don du phyogs snga ma dgod pa ni / 'dir dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to refute the assertion that things arise from others, the counterparts‚Äô position is presented:üîΩHere the counterparts say, ‚ÄúThings arise from other causes.

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu rnams ga las skye zhes smras pa de la mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu rnams ga las skye zhes smras pa de la mi rigs so //
translated: Why? Because it is untenable to say that things arise from themselves.

original: mi rigs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩ'di ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'di ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the untenability of this, it is said,üîΩ‚ÄúThings do not arise from others, because it is untenable that things arise from other things that exist.‚Äù

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad du gyur pa las so //üîΩrgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad du gyur pa las so // rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen no //
translated: ‚ÄúOther things‚Äù refers to different things.üîΩ‚ÄúCauses‚Äù refers to the causal condition.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: ‚ÄúObjects‚Äù refers to the objective condition.

original: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is the immediately antecedent condition.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: The dominant condition is the dominant condition.

original: rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the causal condition and so on, he says:

original: de la kha cig na re @131b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re @131b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, some say that the causal condition is the six causes.

original: 'dir rgyu ni drug ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni drug ste /
translated: Here, the causes are six:

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the active cause, the co-existent cause, the homogeneous cause, the associated cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause.

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi byed pa'i rgyu'o //üîΩgal te gang gis 'di byed pa de rnams byed pa'i rgyu yin grang na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi byed pa'i rgyu'o // gal te gang gis 'di byed pa de rnams byed pa'i rgyu yin grang na /
translated: Here, the active cause is the cause of conditioned phenomena, which is not their own nature, and of unconditioned phenomena.

original: gang gis 'di mi byed pa de rnams ci ltar byed pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'di mi byed pa de rnams ci ltar byed pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIf that which causes this is the active cause, then what is the active cause of that which does not cause this?‚Äù

original: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the active cause because it does not obstruct arising.

original: gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams gegs mi byed pa'i sgo nas byed pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams gegs mi byed pa'i sgo nas byed pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can those that are unable to obstruct become active causes by not obstructing?

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, like nirvana, etc.

original: 'di yang mthong ste grong gi dpon po nus pa med du zin kyang grong gi mi rnams 'dis kho bo cag bde bar byas so zhes brjod par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di yang mthong ste grong gi dpon po nus pa med du zin kyang grong gi mi rnams 'dis kho bo cag bde bar byas so zhes brjod par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: This is also seen, for even if the village chief is powerless, the villagers say, ‚ÄúHe makes us happy.‚Äù

original: des na gnyis ka la yang gegs mi byed par 'gyur ba yod pas byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na gnyis ka la yang gegs mi byed par 'gyur ba yod pas byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since both are not obstructed, there is no contradiction in being active causes.

original: chos gang dag phan tshun 'bras bu can yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos gang dag phan tshun 'bras bu can yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Those phenomena that are mutually resultant are co-arisen causes.

original: phan tshun gyi stobs kyis de rnams 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi stobs kyis de rnams 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they operate by the power of each other.

original: sems ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: sems ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The mind is the co-arisen cause of mental factors that follow the mind.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Also, those that are concomitant with the mind are coemergent causes of the mind.

original: phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba yin pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba yin pas so //
translated: Because they are mutually concomitant.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Characteristics and the basis of those characteristics are coemergent causes.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni skye ba la sogs pa yin la /üîΩde rnams mtshan gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni skye ba la sogs pa yin la / de rnams mtshan gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Among them, characteristics are arising and so on.üîΩThey are coemergent causes of the basis of those characteristics.

original: mtshan gzhi yang de rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi yang de rnams kyi yin te /
translated: The basis of those characteristics is also their coemergent cause.

original: phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually concomitant.

original: chos 'dra ba rnams chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dra ba rnams chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Dharmas similar to those are homogeneous causes of dharmas similar to those.

original: dper na dge ba'i chos rnams dge ba'i chos rnams kyi yin /
analyzed: dper na dge ba'i chos rnams dge ba'i chos rnams kyi yin /
translated: For example, virtuous dharmas are of virtuous dharmas,

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: nonvirtuous dharmas are of nonvirtuous dharmas, and neutral dharmas are of neutral dharmas.

original: de yang sngar bskyed pa rnams phyis skye ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de yang sngar bskyed pa rnams phyis skye ba rnams kyis so //
translated: and those that arise later are the homogeneous cause of those that arose earlier.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni rten gcig pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni rten gcig pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag ste /
translated: The concomitant cause is the mind and mental factors that have the same support.

original: dper na @132a * //
analyzed: dper na @132a * //
translated: For example,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: the eye sense faculty that is the support of the eye consciousness is also the support of the feeling and so on that are concomitant with it.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yid kyi dbang po'i skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yid kyi dbang po'i skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the mind faculty that is the support of mental consciousness and the mental factors that are concomitant with it.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: Whatever is a concomitant cause is also a coemergent cause.

original: yang don gang gis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin zhing gang gis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang don gang gis na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin zhing gang gis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between a coemergent cause and a concomitant cause?

original: phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: They are coemergent causes because they are reciprocal results.

original: 'dron  po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dron  po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like a group of travelers who proceed on the road by the power of each other.

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa ste lnga'i sgo nas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa ste lnga'i sgo nas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: They are homogeneous causes because they are similar in five ways:

original: 'dron  po de dag nyid zas la sogs pa'i longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dron  po de dag nyid zas la sogs pa'i longs spyod pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like those travelers who are similar in their use of food and so on.

original: gcig med na yang mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: gcig med na yang mtshungs par mi ldan pas 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Since they are not homogeneous if even one of these is absent, this is the nature of their cause.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rang gi sa bon gyi kun tu 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rang gi sa bon gyi kun tu 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Universal causes are dharmas that are universal seeds. Universal dharmas that arise earlier are universal causes of afflicted dharmas.

original: de la kun tu 'gro ba'i chos ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun tu 'gro ba'i chos ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The phenomena that are pervasive are the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, clinging to those views as supreme and clinging to rules and ritual as well as to the self as supreme, which are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.üîΩ

original: lta ba lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa dang ; the tshom ste /üîΩsdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste lta ba gnyis dang / de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa dang the tshom ste /
analyzed: lta ba lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa dang ; the tshom ste / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste lta ba gnyis dang / de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa dang the tshom ste /
translated: The phenomena that are omnipresent are the five views: the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and clinging to those as supreme that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and ignorance and doubt that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.üîΩThus there are seven that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste bzhi'o /
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste bzhi'o /
translated: There are four that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin: the two views of wrong view and clinging to those as supreme that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and ignorance and doubt that are to be abandoned by seeing that truth.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa can bcu gcig ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa can bcu gcig ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus there are eleven afflicted states that are omnipresent.

original: nyon mongs pa can spyi'i rgyu yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs su rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can spyi'i rgyu yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs su rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Since it is the general cause of afflicted entities, it is posited separately from homogeneous causes.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i yang rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i yang rgyu yin pas so //
translated: It is also a cause of dissimilar types.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang @132b bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang @132b bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is nonvirtuous entities and contaminated virtuous entities.

original: de la byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa ldan ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa ldan ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The condition as cause is all causes except for the active cause.

original: de la dmigs par bya bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ci ltar srid par dmigs pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs par bya bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ci ltar srid par dmigs pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The objective condition is all entities, both conditioned and unconditioned, as objects of observation.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yin pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos thams cad yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yin pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos thams cad yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: For example, form is the objective condition of the eye consciousness and its concomitant states, up to all phenomena are the objective condition of the mental consciousness.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sems las zhes bya ba ni gang gi phung po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'jug pa'i sems gang yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sems las zhes bya ba ni gang gi phung po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'jug pa'i sems gang yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that enters nirvana without remainder is the mind that enters nirvana, which has the characteristic of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sems ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sems ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mind that enters nirvana is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of that mind,

original: de'i de ma thag tu phung po 'gags pas sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni gang rgyu'i rkyen gyi nang du byed pa'i rgyu ma brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu phung po 'gags pas sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro ; / byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni gang rgyu'i rkyen gyi nang du byed pa'i rgyu ma brjod pa ste /
translated: because the aggregates cease immediately after it, and mind and mental factors do not arise.üîΩThe efficient cause is the dominant condition.

original: bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //üîΩgang zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so // gang zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that the efficient cause is not mentioned among the conditions because it is the dominant condition.üîΩThat which is the cause is the efficient cause.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: That by which is the effect.

original: skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthat which generates‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which exists in the nature of a seed.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu skyed pa la rung ba nyid du gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa la rung ba nyid du gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which exists in a state of suitability for generating an effect.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to that which generates.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the effect.

original: rgyu las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: rgyu las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: ‚Äú From a cause‚Äù refers to a cause such as the eye.

original: dmigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú By means of an object‚Äù refers to such things as form.

original: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang 'gags nas gang skye ba de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang 'gags nas gang skye ba de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: ‚Äú The cause that has just ceased‚Äù and so forth means that the equivalent immediately antecedent condition is that which has ceased and from which something arises.

original: gang zhig yod na zhes bya ba ni sa dang snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na zhes bya ba ni sa dang snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú When something exists‚Äù refers to such things as the earth and light.

original: gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni myu gu dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni myu gu dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú When something occurs‚Äù refers to such things as a sprout and visual consciousness.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang phyi nas skyes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de la lhan cig skyes pa ni dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa phan tshun rgyur 'dod pa bzhin no //üîΩphyir nas skye ba la sogs pa ni dper na dus thams cad dngos po yod par smra ba @133a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang phyi nas skyes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de la lhan cig skyes pa ni dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa phan tshun rgyur 'dod pa bzhin no // phyir nas skye ba la sogs pa ni dper na dus thams cad dngos po yod par smra ba @133a * //
translated: Coemergent and subsequent are, for example, like the mutual cause of mind and mental factors, etc.

original: rnams kyis dngos por gyur pa'i ma 'ongs pa shes pa'i rgyur 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnams kyis dngos por gyur pa'i ma 'ongs pa shes pa'i rgyur 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: Subsequent are, for example, like the cause of consciousness in the future that is asserted by those who say that things exist at all times.

original: de dag kyang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa snga ma ltar rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi nang du 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa snga ma ltar rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi nang du 'dus pa yin la /
translated: They are included in these, i.e., they are included in the causal condition and the dominant condition, as explained above.

original: bshad pa phyi ma ltar na bdag po'i rkyen gyi nang du 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa phyi ma ltar na bdag po'i rkyen gyi nang du 'dus pa'o //
translated: Or they are included in the dominant condition, as explained above.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang bdag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang bdag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Isvara, etc., are not conditions. The word etc. includes prakriti, purusha, etc.

original: de rnams rtag pa nyid yin pas 'bras bu byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de rnams rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rtag pa nyid yin pas 'bras bu byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de rnams rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Because they are permanent, it is contradictory for them to produce an effect, and therefore they are not conditions.

original: de ltar gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs snga ma bkod nas ;
analyzed: de ltar gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs snga ma bkod nas ;
translated: Having thus set forth the opponent‚Äôs position that things are produced from other,

original: lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the response to that,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis is illogical,‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pa'o //
